reviewTitle: Great sound and ANC, terrible Bluetooth connection, hardware quality and customer service
reviewDescription: *Update* I've now gone through 4 pairs in less than a year. The quality control on these is atrocious. Different issues for each pair. The latest pair does not charge to 100% and the case seems to hold no charge at all. Also, there is so much white noise in quiet mode that it distracts from the audio. An lastly, the Bluetooth connection is unstable and I frequently (at least half the time) have to erase and reconnect as it won't connect to my phone. The customer service has been less than useless. If you can get a hold of them, they will just direct you to some random and unrelated "troubleshooting" steps to follow which is generally just disconnect, hard reset and reconnect which never fixes anything. I have eventually convinced them to give me a refund though even that I'm unsure of because they refuse to send me a confirmation that they will provide a refund until they actually receive the unit. I will never own a Bose product again.*I want to love these because of the sound quality but the software used to run the headphones just seems to be terrible. I had to return the first pair I bought right away because the touch controls weren't working. Second pair worked great for about 6 months. Now they can't stay connected to my phone and make a horrible popping noise every 20 seconds or so as they disconnect and try to reconnect. Touch controls are also not functioning well anymore (when I can secure a connection). And don't bother trying to use their chat support. No one will ever pick up. I've been trying for three days and no luck. For the price of these buds I would expect MUCH better quality and service.

reviewDescription: I was a bit of a skeptic when it came to wireless headphones, theses headphones absolutely changed my mind.The noise cancellation at first is a bit weird, but after a day or two, it's an amazing feature. It blocks everything, no joke, and I have a very good hearing. I have other headphones, without noise cancellation that I sometimes use, but I immediately notice the difference. The noise cancellation is just making the sound more crisp and audible.The sound is great, and can also be adjusted with the Bose Music app.It worked 100% with my Galaxy phone, no issues, no hassle (make sure you install "Bose Music").The headphones come with 3 ear adjustments, so make sure they are properly fitted. They don't come off easily afterwards.I can also wear the headphones for long periods, no issues.Touch controls work great as well.Some things that I did notice:- The battery life is okay I guess, although I do feel that it could be a bit better (not exactly sure what is the equivalent with other headphones). The case also acts as a charger, event when it's not plugged in.- I wish I could disable the touch controls temporarily because sometimes when I jog (I live in a colder climate), I wear a jogging running coat with a built in hoodie, and when it gets soaked with sweat, the touch controls are triggered.- Sweat slightly alter the headphones ability to stay inside the ears (but that is expected, as they aren't designed for sport).

reviewDescription: I have been using the ear buds for more than 3 weeks by now, here are the things I am impressed by the product:-it has the best noise cancellation, I compared side by side with AirPods (gen 2) and I don’t think AirPods are nearly half as good as bose-the sound quality is exceptional for this size, so rich that you would think you are carrying a mini sound system with you-the awareness mode is super helpful when you are walking out on the streets, you still get very good sound effects with this mode-charging time is very fast-the colour, the touch and the design are luxurious, pure joyHowever, I have a few things that I didn’t enjoy very much with the product:-the buds are not as comfortable as AirPods simply because they are larger, and they require the tight seal around the ear holes, which adds to the discomfort in the long run, but acceptable. reviewDescription: I bought these Bose to replace a recently lost pair of Samsung pro earbuds. I have owned or listened to a wide variety of the brand name earbuds and have no hesitation in stating these are the best earbuds I've listened to yet. The sound quality is rich and immersive. The ability to just slide your finger up or down to increase or decrease volume is much better than trying to complete the required amount of taps or find the small section where this command will work.These are by far the best earbuds I have owned or tried and I highly recommend them for their excellent sound reproduction, ease of use and very comfortable/secure fit.

reviewTitle: These are pretty good, but the customization feels lacking for the price.
reviewDescription: In short, these have a decent sound signature for music, decent noise cancelling, good battery life, and are very comfortably made. However, the passive noise isolation is quite bad so it brings down the quality of the noise cancelling.Also for this price, they're lacking in some features like customizable touch controls and an in-app equalizer which I would've thought were basically guaranteed on pricey wireless earbuds like these.Pros-(1)- Quite comfortable. I fell asleep with them on and woke up without any pain in my ears.-(2)- The case is hard to open because it's locked close with a button latch. I consider this a good thing because I prefer my earbuds to be secure in their case.Neutrals-(3)- Noise cancelling is "fairly" good. These seem to cancel noises properly, but are let down by their somewhat lacking passive noise isolation (preventing noise through the earbud itself) so you can still hear louder noises directly through the earbuds even if they're technically "cancelling" it. When I used these during my transit via train, I could constantly hear the low rumble of the heater fans and the high-pitch whirring of the motors when the train sped up or slowed down.As a side note, the noise cancelling is decent at not picking up wind gusts, although medium/strong wind gusts still cause a small amount of noise.-(4)- The default sound signature is quite nice and it'll probably satisfy a lot of people, but there's something about it that's lacking "fun". It has good clarity in mids and highs without being too harsh, and the bass is there albeit a bit pulled back. My issue lies with how the sub-bass below the bass is so pulled back that there's basically no "oomph" to any song I listen to which has sub-bass.-(5)- So far I haven't had any issues with connectivity, even in the middle of downtown. The only connection issue I've had is that the earbuds sometimes stutter for ~1 second every now and then (but only once or twice a day) before reconnecting like nothing happened.Cons-(6)- The passive sound isolation is pretty weak. I mentioned this when I talked about how it makes the noise cancelling worse, but it also prevents you from listening to music at medium/high volume. This is because your music just bleeds right out and you become a nuisance to everyone around you.With how much sound gets past the noise cancelling because of the lacking passive noise isolation, you end up wanting to listen to music at a slightly higher volume to drown out the extra outside noise, but doing that makes your noise leak out to your surroundings. The lacking noise isolation just brings about a lose-lose situation.-(7)- These are missing so many basic music controls it's not even funny. The only 2 touch controls you have for music are double-tap right earbud for play/pause, and press-and-hold left earbud to go to the next track. This is LITERALLY all you get as touch options. Every other touch combination is for calls and phone helper stuff with no options to customize them whatsoever.I am most certainly not happy about this lack of customization for the touch controls. The touch controls should let me play/pause, skip to next/previous track, and volume +/- if I want them to. If touch controls are the reason for these limitations, I would've preferred the physical buttons like the ones on the Bose SoundSport Free.Edit (2022-10-02): I've heard the app apparently lets you customize the touch controls now, so that's good to hear. Too bad it wasn't like that on release.-(8)- There's no equalizer in the Bose app. Sure, the default sound signature is okay and you could argue for third-party equalizers, but why don't they give us a simple equalizer in the app for these pricey $350 earbuds?ConclusionPersonally, I wouldn't recommend these simply because the passive noise isolation is weak. These earbuds do get quite a bit done right, like comfort and sound, but the weak noise isolation takes it down quite a few ranks.[--A bit about these compared to Sony WF-1000XM3's--]Since I have the Sony WF-1000XM3's which are basically direct competitors to these, I'll just point out that the Sony WF-1000XM3's are cheaper and have all the extra features which these Bose don't have.For instance, you can customize almost all your touch controls on the Sony, and there's an in-app equalizer to adjust the sound to your taste.Where the Sony's lose out to the Bose is in terms of water protection and comfort/fit. The Sony's have the absolute stupidest design when it comes to comfort/fit with no ear wings to hold the earbuds in your ears, so these Bose are 500% better at staying in your ears comfortably.

reviewTitle: Meh, with an aftertaste of 'disappointing' and hint of 'can't be buggered sending 'em back'
reviewDescription: Owning both the old QC15 and QC25 over-the-air models, I was expecting better.Yes, these earbuds have better sound reproduction and (marginally) better noise cancelling than my AirPod Pro's, but they're some distance from the noise cancelling on the old QC15/QC25 over-the-ears. I tested all three ear fit options with only marginal differences in noise cancelling and settled on the 2+ size as the best fit for my ears. It must mean I've got Orc ears or something. I blame mum.I'll keep these Bose ear buds and they'll get some use as an alternate/back-up to the AirPod Pro's, but when I'm going on the plane or am in a situation when I want decent noise cancelling, I'll definitely be bringing the old over-the-ear models. They've yet to be beat by any other model or brand, plus it's nice to have the old school option along the lines of "Oops, ran out of battery on a 16 hour flight...guess I'll just pop in a spare AA battery" rather than doing the "Oh bugger, now I'll have to listen to a screaming child for an hour while I do a Not-So-Quick-Charge" and subtlety ask the flight attendant for three wee bottles of scotch and whether she could slip another one to that kid?Regarding the app, no issues there in terms of set-up or functionality, and was able to quickly set up other Bluetooth sources (in addition to my iPhone and iPad, I also utilize an Airfly for creating a Bluetooth output from my Denon amp and bedroom telly).Tip for people like me who can't resist generally buggering around with things, I ended up using the same trick I used with my AirPod Pro's to get a little better fit for noise cancelling. It found with AirPod Pros and with these Bose Ear Buds that the ear-tip fit thingy's plastic is a little too pliable and could do with having a bit more resistance:- using a pair of sharp scissors, I cut the narrower end off a pair of foam ear plugs (about 1cm or so...or about god knows what in Imperial measurements. Imperial lost me at '4 groats equals 1 scrotum').- using a leather punch (you know the ones, look like a pair of scissors but with a wheelie-thing housing different sized punches to create different sized holes), I punched out a hole down the centre of the foam tip.- scrunch up the narrower end of the ear tip fitter things that come with the ear buds and shove it through the hole in the foam ear plug pieces and fold back down. In a nutshell, this is basically just getting ear plug foam underneath the plastic bit that sits in your ear to give a bit of resistance.- For me at least, just having that extra bit of push from the foam ear plug pieces up against the business end of the ear bud plastic makes a bit of a difference in terms of a seal. I'm sure both the Apple overlords and Boseans have tested their ear tip creations and swear up, down and sideways that we're living the dream in terms of their ear-fit technology, but whether my ears lost out in the chromosome wars or no-one actually thought of a bit of pushy foam doing the trick, it works for me. There, done. Now, go make a cuppa and carry on thinking about your life choices.

reviewTitle: Broke after 3 years of use, decent but outdated
reviewDescription: They finally quit on me: the left earbud has gone after 3 years. RIP o7These earbuds were good for their time, however the case is bulky and round, and never really fits well in any pocket or bag. The battery life is also a little lackluster: won't take you through a plane trip of continuous listening, though if you charge them in the case they last at least most of the day.I would very much recommend looking for newer models with a flatter case, better battery, and possibly better noise cancelling and sound though those were always the strongpoint of this product.I'll be attempting to get some sort of at least partial refund since 3y is not really an acceptable service life for a product at this price range, however if I don't get one I can't be too upset with the value I got.

reviewTitle: Great Until One Earbud Stopped Charging
reviewDescription: I really liked these headphones until my left ear bud stopped charging about a year after I bought them. I believe it may be an issue with the case. BOSE customer service has been disappointing in troubleshooting and repair options (only suggests buying new ones). For $250 and from a reputable brand, I would have expected better on the longevity and service fronts.Otherwise, the noise cancellation and sound are great. They also stay in and don’t budge, so they are great for the gym.I have heard that the quality of the microphone during calls is unpleasant, so I would not recommend them if you want to use them to make calls.
was a gift from my husband.  I wasn't that satisfied for the price.  ended up with another brand for under 70$.

I have been a loyal bose purchaser for years. As a HoH person I find their products are very hard of hearing friendly. But not this product. I'm so disappointed in it. The sound is only decent connected to the phone. Any other device like my TV, laptop, iPad the sound is almost nonexistent. And I've asked full hearing people to test for me and it's terrible. I am so disappointed in this product. I spent a lot of money and my old Quiet comfort headphones kicked the can after years of daily use, I should have just bought the same ones again as they still make them. But I really wanted in ear ones I could hide under my hair like I can with my hearing aids.With that said, the connection is great. They fit my ear well. They connect easily. But the battery often lies to me. The phone will say the battery is low but if I put them in the battery pack plugged in, it says the battery is good. Which is annoying if you're not near a plug in.

reviewTitle: 5 stars for the product, and 1 star for Amazon
reviewDescription: I like the product, works fantastic, especially the noise cancelling feature. It takes a bit to get used to the controls, but really, I don't use them too much anyway.Amazon though, was a huge fail on this. They shipped me used headphones. They looked a little suspicious when I was opening them, but, I was certain when I went to pair them and they were trying to connect to other dudes phone.I wasn't happy, to say the least, but was leaving for a few days, and wanted to takem with me, so I switched the ear fittings to ones in an unopened bag, and decided that I'd use them, but, would return them for the smallest problem.Haven't had one in about 1 year...Still, displeased that I paid full price for a used product...

reviewTitle: Awesome YET dont lose or break the case
reviewDescription: I mean, it's on me i guess but at this price you can expect that the case can be sold separetly if you break or lose it. But no, for the second generation yes but not this one. So go for it if you are sure about never losing it or anything, because if you do your earbuds are worthless, you cant charge them with another case from someone else or anything.So go for the second generation if you can afford it, this one isnt really worth the price.

reviewTitle: Best in class Noise Cancelling Earbuds - Muddy Sound - Decent Fit
reviewDescription: For context I love music and this is my 3rd pair of Bose noise cancelling headphones / earbuds. Just for context I also own what people may call audiophile headphones (Audeze LCD-XC, Dekoni Blues, and HD660s).  If you are looking for best in class noise cancelling earbuds, look no further.  If you are looking for a great sound signature and don't care about noise cancelling, look somewhere else.  The biggest shock to me was that they don't block out sound like a QC35 would, these let in a bit more ambient sound.  I'm guessing this is so that you can hear what is around you (even in quiet mode).  Sound stage isn't very large, the highs and mids are lacking, and the bass, well its bose, there is plenty of bass. Problem is this does make for muddy sounding music, especially with female vocals.  I find the earbuds fit nicely, and do a good enough job on the subway blocking out noise.  My only true complaint would be battery life, knowing full well that the audio quality  wouldn't compare to an LCD-XC as an example.  Unlike Beats or other headphones, I have nothing but a solid bluetooth connection with my Samsung S21 Ultra. Hope this helps :)

reviewTitle: Good product when (if) it works right
reviewDescription: Have had a really unfortunate experience with the product. Had high expectations from the Bose brand and it's reputation in the noise cancellation space. While the noise cancellation lives up to the billing the product quality was absolutely sub par.The right ear on the pair I purchased stopped charging after a month. No drops, no damage just out of the blue it stopped working. Was disappointed but it was under warranty so customer service replaced them.The replacement pair turned out even more disappointing. Two weeks into using it there was an issue with the in-ear sensor and it stopped playing audio. Turns out it's a common issue with the headphones and it's been reported by others before. Additionally, they began to randomly drop Audio during calls, which rendered them further useless.Once might have been an aberration but to face these issues on two seperate pairs highlights that Bose might be slipping as a manufacturer. For this price, might be better served looking elsewhere.

reviewTitle: Great Audio and ANC but broke after a year
reviewDescription: Amazing notice cancelling. Superb audio quality.The downsides: mine only lasted 1 year and now no longer connects, despite taking great care of them. Charging case is bulky. Lastly, the price: if these had lasted 2-3 years I could stomach the price. But $250 for one year is a little steep.

Been with nose since 2015, nothing new you know what they are providing paying $250+ with their product, noice canceling is top notch, it’s true you can’t use the left ear unless the right is out of the charging box, but that don’t bother me at all. Batteries are longer than most people said here for me, full blast about 6-7 hours for me… overall sure I’d recommend it if $$ not your concern

I really, really wanted to be able to keep using these, but unfortunately am returning them as they were too uncomfortable to wear for more than about an hour. I wanted them for long days of 4-8 hours on Zoom. The sound quality is great. The mic works really well even for long calls. The noise cancellation is impressive for being earbuds. They stayed in place fine for a moderate intensity workout.But, they are just too bulky. They are so big compared to other earbuds. They don't look to bad, but have consistently caused pain. Even with the smallest ear insert, they feel like they stretch my ears a bit, plus make them feel tired and achy after a few hours. They've caused me headaches every single time (6 or so trials of several hours). I'm not sure if this is due to the noise cancelling technology, as I am very prone to barotrauma thus may be prone to issues with this as well. Or, it could simply be due to the ear discomfort.If you can stomach the price, I think these are worth trying if your priority is mic/call quality +/- noise cancellation, along with good music quality, as many do seem to find them comfortable. I hope Bose comes out with a more sleek version as technology improves. Be careful as some in store locations do not allow returns, but the return process is smooth with Amazon or the Bose website.

reviewTitle: It’s great. It fits me well. But it wont last long…
reviewDescription: Pros: I love Bose for the sound quality (these don't disappoint). These fit me well and the noise cancellation is phenomenal…Cons kinda:Gestures are kind of awkward (will take some getting used to). Will have to make proper use of the “shortcuts” in the app you have to download. You cant seem to have reverse and fast forward while playing music as a gesture. (Forced to pick 1 of 4 functions)No problems connecting to iPhone (even before I downloaded the app)Cons: Battery life on each ear pieces. Wish they could give it a higher capacity battery…There are better longer lasting product out there. I care about the sound quality for the price I’m paying (& noise cancelling). So this fits me well.

Upgrade from QC 20 myself, here are some PROs and CONs:PROs:- Best of the best ANC out there at the moment 2020.- Super comfy- Good acoustic sounds, bass is a lot better compares to QC 20 and my old QC 15. But still, bass never was a selling point of this brand. But trust me on this model, the bass doesn't sound like u hit a bat into a trash can anymore. Not the best but enjoyable.CONs:- Well, currently Microsoft app(PC) store doesn't have Bose Music app, so the only way to access to it is via phones. Listen to music on laptop often? Then u are doomed, u have to disconnect from laptop, connect to phone to access to the app, and reconnect back to laptop once more. like WTF? Because there is no ways to tell what ANC level u are on. You have to see it via the app.- Would be nice if they have somethings like swipe up or down to Skip or Backward song, kinda hassle to pull out your phone out to skip a song....- BULKY, i feel like im walking around with 2 big toes sticking out on my ears .

reviewTitle: Really good earbuds, when it fits right
reviewDescription: this is a really good wireless earbuds for anyone looking for good audio quality and noise cancelation and battery life. however if your ear is not the perfect size to match either three of the sizes that comes with the buds you will be fighting to keep them in your ear, other than that it's a great product and would definitely recommend.

reviewTitle: Impressive Sound and Noise Cancelling, Mixed App Experience with Bose QuietComfort Earbuds
reviewDescription: The Bose QuietComfort Noise Cancelling Earbuds have truly impressed me with their exceptional sound quality and top-notch noise cancellation. The immersive audio experience they provide is a treat for music lovers and those seeking a quiet escape.While the earbuds themselves shine, I found the accompanying app to be a bit underwhelming considering the premium price. However, the standout feature of these earbuds was the outstanding customer support I received when I encountered a defective pair. Bose's excellent service ensured I received a replacement promptly.Overall, the Bose QuietComfort Earbuds offer an immersive audio experience with great noise cancellation, and their stellar customer support makes up for any app-related shortcomings.
Tiennent très bien à l'oreille, le mode silencieux est très efficace
Love the and quality however the fitting is off on the ear peice. Either to small or to big

reviewTitle: Don’t use these if you work with power tools
reviewDescription: Earbuds look way better than the first generation, and all aspects are better except one. The noise canceling is the problem for me. It does a way better job than the previous generation for regular constant noise. But using these around power tools, like an impact driver. It overloads the speakers and you get a noise like crackling and popping that is probably louder than not having them in your ears at all. I really wanted to love these, but it’s the air pods pro 2 for me, seems they have a better way of processing the anc, and even the loudest noises don’t cause them to crackle and pop in my ear.

I had these in my cart for a while and pulled the trigger when they went on sale on Prime Day. Delivery was quick. Product was sealed. I followed the instructions provided, downloaded the Bose app, and connected the earbuds to my Samsung phone. They connected - I was able to adjust noise cancellation and at the max, it blocked out the sound of the fan in my room which was impressive. The app displayed the battery life charge on both earbuds at 90%.I then tried to play audio, such as spotify or youtube, on my phone. The tracks and videos would play but no audio from the earbuds despite being connected. I tried troubleshooting it using the Bose website, restarted my phone, put the earbuds into the charge, etc. Tried everything really but couldn't get them to play any audio - and yes the volume was up and nothing was muted. When bluetooth was off, the audio would play as normal on my phone. I reconnected and tried again, no audio from earbuds. They randomly disconnected themselves from my phone, and the light on the right earbud was out. I placed them into the charger case, and the left earbud lit up as normal but the right one did not. I let them charge for a while, but the right earbud never turned on and couldn't be connected. As per the manual, the right earbud is the 'master' and if it doesn't work, nothing will. Since it did not play audio, I cannot comment on the sound quality.I called product support and the Amazon attendant walked me through some basic troubleshooting such as recalibrating the charger but nothing changed. She transferred me to another Amazon attendant in the appropriate department and I was on hold for a while but the call dropped.So I returned the product. It's too early and too expensive to be having these sort of issues. It was my first time trying Bose and I expected better.

Box damaged on arrival, left ear bud is damaged there is a low fuzz on everything I play. They need the station and cannot be turned off, battery drains within 8 hours of not being used. The sound is muffled oddly like it is trapped under water. They are about the worst pair of headphones/earbuds I have ever listened to, and I had a bose set just previously that lasted more than 3 years before I accidentally damaged them.BOSE QuietDontTellPeopleTheseSuck is not worth your money these are not worth 100 bucks.Customer service, this company is garbage, they refuse to replace the item and want you to go through the entire return process plus wait 30 days (if they require 30 days for refunds to visa it is because they have very poor credit rating and are not trusted by the banks) hence not a 5 day grace period but a 30 day.Avoid buying from this retailer at all costs.
Stopped working entirely in less than 2 years. Starting having issues way before that too. Planned obsolescence bs. Also they don't work independently which defeats the point of wireless buds.

I'll start by saying I'm a huge bose fan and it hurts me to give a bad review for these earbuds.I bought a first set of these on day and they were great sounding but had an issue with the mic not working well, people couldn't hear me on calls in a quiet room.  After a day the right earbud would not connect, not charge and the earbuds became useless.  I tried all of the reset and pairing options online, but none worked.I returned the first pair and got a replacement pair.  The mics worked great the sound was still excellent.  Within the first couple hours of use, ran into the same issue with the right earbud.  Tried everything contacted bose support with no luck although they offered to replace themNot sure I want to go through this experience a 3rd time.  Very disappointed and surprised at the quality issues with this bose product.  I'm using an s22 ultra phone and iPad pro so don't think it should be a compatibility issue.

Earbuds didn't even last 18 months. When I contacted Bose they just said its outside the 1 year warranty period and nothing can be done. They recommended I buy new ear buds. That's it. Horrible service. Instead one should invest in cheap wired earbuds and buy a new one every year.

If your ears are not PERFECT they will not stay in your ears.  Once one decides to leap out the F your ear and you’re unable to find it… well,; that’s not a BOSE problem, that’s a you problem.  Don’t give this company anymore of your money because they won’t stand behind their terrible fitting product.  I’m out nearly $300 because they refuse to refund or even replace this useless product.

I’ve owned these since last August (5 months). Great sound. The noise cancellation is better than my QC45s, which cost more. I love thèse, even if they are a little chunky. They stay put.My dog decided the charging case needed to die. But he spared the life of the earbuds. Cool. I’ll just find another charging case. Ah, but there are NONE. Bose’s solution is to sell me a new set of QuietComfort II earbuds at $100 off.Dear Bose, you made the only earbuds that fit my little ears. The rest fall out all the time. Your new design of the QuietComfort II earbuds will not fit me.I just want a freakin’ charger case! So frustrating that I have to buy a whole new pair with a charger case.1 star for not selling a separate replacement charging case. Apple has one. Samsung has one. Jabra has one. Bose has one for the QuietComfort II earbuds. Meh.

reviewTitle: Amazing sounding earbuds but can't be worn for more than 1 hour
reviewDescription: These are by far the best sounding earbuds I've ever tried, a good amount of base without drowning out the treble. The noise cancelation is amazing, in my woodshop I can have the dust collector running, and these completely canceled out the sound.The only problem was that I could only wear them for 30 minutes comfortably, after the 30 minutes they started getting unconformable. When I removed them, it felt like I was getting punched in the ear and I had to wait at least an hour before I could put them back in. I thought that it was just a matter of time before my ears got used to them but after three days of forcing myself to use them, I couldn't deal with the pain and returned them. I've been wearing earbuds for the past 5 years so I have no idea why these are so uncomfortable.These earbuds are the equivalent of buying a Ferrari with a bench seat, they sound awesome but you can't use them for very long.

We’ve bought many BOSE products over the years and have always been impressed. Even our children bought their products. My current earbuds started to act up and I decided I wanted to buy something that would last, so I decided to treat myself and buy Bose earbuds. Nicely packaged and fit was decent but I wonder if they would stay in place during my workouts. After trying them I was so disappointed and even when the bass was turned to max it had little punch. My $90:earbuds had more bass. Within 3 hours I said no…I packed it up and returning it. For $300 I should have better sound then my $90 pair. No doubt I will never buy Bose after this experience..so sad

My sister bought this for my birthday and I was so excited but it really sucks... I cannot increase/decrease volume with it even though it is a feature that comes with it, can't play/pause music because every time I try to tap it to stop or play, I have to tap a dozen times before it functions and then it pauses and plays multiple times because I had tapped it so many times to get it to work. Same thing with the left earphone when I want to switch from quiet mode to aware, it doesn't work and I tap it a dozen times again for it to bounce back and forth between quite and aware before I'm frustrated and just remove my earphones... I can't believe these are being sold at this price when they are garbage.

I am a first to active noise cancelling (ANC) products, so here are my honest thoughts:PROS:- Shipping time was astonishingly fast.- The earbuds sound amazing whether you are at a low or high volume, the bass/medium/treble does not lack in any way.- The battery life for a single charge is amazing (6 hours)! They are definitely underselling these, since I even got to use them for around 7 hours too.- They allow wireless charging, so that’s a given.- They allow a tight but comfortable fit in the ear, so whether you are running or shaking, these earbuds will not budge a single bit.- They are sweat and splash resistant, so you don’t need to worry about taking too much care for them ;)- They allow great and accurate touch-controls, easy to use and you can pick from various options (volume control, pause/play, ANC changes, voice-control assistent, calls, etc.)- These earbuds allow up to 11 noise cancelling options, from ‘Aware mode’ (transparency mode) to ‘Quiet Mode’ (full noise cancelling).- Since I am a first to ANC products, I can’t give an accurate review on how the ANC is, however, from my honest opinion, it isn’t that bad! They really do feel like a good pair of earplugs.- The case has a button to securely lock it and prevent the earbuds from flying on if you accidentally drop them.- The case also indicates the amount of battery it has left with the given 5 LED lights.- Supports quick connection to 11 multiple devices (can only be connected at one at the time).- Bose Quietcomfort Earbuds has a quick charge option: 15-mins charge for a 2 hours of playback.- Neither case nor earbuds will be overcharged if left charging overnight.- Can turn on ANC when no music is playing.CONS:- Granted we are moving to a wireless earbuds/headphones world, these Bose Quietcomfort earbuds’ charging case is a bit large to carry around. It fits snugly in a bag, but in your pocket, not so much.- You can’t sleep with these on, unless if you sleep on your back. Otherwise, it will be quite uncomfortable.- Some people might complain about the short battery life the case offers an additional 12 hours of battery life to earbuds: a total of 18 hours combining both earbuds and case.- The earbuds take 2 hours for a complete charge from 0% to 100%.- The charging time for the case alone (0 LEDs to 5 LEDs) is 3 hours.WARNING! (All ANC products have a noise floor, including these Bose Quietcomfort earbuds)I am a first to ANC products, hence I have to share this warning to my fellow people who are also a first to ANC products. Since ANC is a product of an anti-phase wave to the sounds around you, which is emitted by a microphone within the earbuds, the earbuds themselves have a hissing sound, most noticeable when there is no music playing. The hissing/noise floor of the earbuds themselves does not increase nor decrease as ANC goes higher or lower. However, in transparency mode, the surrounding sounds will be projected louder than actual when no major sound in your surroundings is present, thus the hissing sound/noise floor might appear louder than usual (rest assured, it’s just your earbuds trying to project a real sound equivalent to complete silence). However, the hissing/noise floor of the earbuds when the ANC is maxed out is present, but not really loud. And yes, the noise floor can still be heard if music is playing, but only when the music is at a low volume, otherwise, no noise floor can be heard (noise floor never becomes louder depending of ANC).Thank you for taking your time to read this review, I hope it helped you on narrowing out some aspects you already knew and clearing out on those you didn’t know yet.Have a splendid day filled with wonders y’all! :)

I bought the Bose QuietComfort Noise Cancelling Earbuds after trying its 2 main competitors : Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro and Apple AirPods Pro.  I do not understand why some reviews are so good for the Apple AirPods Pro. The  noise cancelling is really not that great, far inferior to Bose and Samsung earbuds. The Apple AirPods Pro I had kept emitting funny noises and the left one was hissing. Apple exchanged it. It worked for a while but the same type of  problems came back. This time I was out of their warranty.  I then bought the Samsung Galaxy Buds Pro. Used them for a week. Returned them. The noise cancelling was quite good, better then Apple. I did not like the fit. The reason I returned them had to do with 2 things: they would skip ounce in a while, more then what I found acceptable and once in a while, one of the buds would not work.  If you put it back in the case, put it back on then it would work. Very annoying. After the Apple adventure, I did not take any chances and returned them.  Then I bought Bose QuietComfort Noise Cancelling Earbuds and I have been using them for a month.  They are by far the best of the 3. The  noise cancelling is really the best. I have done the same noise test with all of them. Bose wins! The fit is excellent. You kind of forget you are wearing them. They have little wings that keeps them in the ears. The sound quality is very good, better then Apple and on par with Samsung. You can adjust the noise cancelling by using their App or tapping on the left earbud.  You can program it so that when your phone is ringing, if you insert the earbuds in your ear, it connects automatically to the phone. That said, they are not perfect. I would have liked them to provide a voice feedback when you tap the noise cancelling earbud. I have 4 Apple devices. When you switch from a device to an other, you have to use their App to disconnect it from the previous device and connect it to the new one. That is somewhat annoying.  Apple is better for that aspect. Also, they cost more then Apple or Samsung. Nevertheless I am quite pleased with my Bose QuietComfort Noise Cancelling Earbuds. I’ll stick with them. Considering the fact that I use them everyday, the extra money they cost is more then worth it.
excellent, clear sound. earbuds, although bulky are lightweight and stay put, no matter the activity

Ho my God! Even better than my QC 35 head phones! I Love them so much, don't want to take them off! Very comfortable, I forget I wear them! Well there Bose! Best brand for me. Highest quality, noise cancellation number 1. Very very very happy with this product! I recommend, and believe me, I have tried many, I hate noise  being Asperger and hyper sensitive to annoying sounds and hyper sensitive to everything that touches me and I am completely satisfied with those earbuds. No background noise and no pain wearing them either. They totally worth the price!

I read a plethora (groovy word) of very in-depth analysis from obviously, finely tuned earbud wearers. Some of them were a tad long-winded…to say the very least. Here’s the deal from my perspective. If you’re looking for a decent set of earbuds whilst (2nd groovy word) doing active sports, etc. with decent sound quality whether it be for music and/or phone calls, these are a good-go. “No”…they may not have the sound quality of a $500.00-&1K + set but they don’t cost that much. The End. Thanks for listening.Regards,me

reviewTitle: Wow. Excellent son et bonne supression du bruit exterieur.
reviewDescription: Le son est excellent, très bonne bass et le volume est très bien. L'application Bose Music permet d'ajuster quelques paramètres comme égaliseur des fréquences, raccourci pour 2 niveaux d'atténuation de bruit externe qui est excellente en passant. Vous avez le choix de 90%, 50% ou aucun. le maximum atténuation que je qualifie a 90% est vraiment bien, on entre dans notre bulle pas a peu près. Normalement, je suis incapable de porter des oreillettes sans cerceau autour de l'oreille (comme les Airpods) puisqu'elle ne tiennent jamais mais les Bose tiennent super bien même pendant mon temps de gym. Je n'ai pas fait un test de batterie complet puisque j’écoute de la musique que 1-3 heures maximum donc pas vraiment un enjeu pour moi. Bref je suis très satisfait a date.
Grate the noise cancelling works grate I also love the wireless charging  capabilities
Really great product. This Bose earphones are amazing!
Cadeau de noël .

reviewTitle: Say goodbye to the world around you.
reviewDescription: The noise cancellation on these earbuds is absolutely mind-shattering.I've been a fan of Bose products for about a decade, which means that, among other things, I own one of each over-ear and in-ear headphones. My earbuds are a recent SoundSport model, and they're great. I had no reason to replace them.. but I'd been patiently waiting for Bose to offer a true wireless option. All this means is that I fully intended on returning these QuietComfort Earbuds if they *didn't* blow my mind.And they did.The noise cancellation is truly remarkable. I work in a laboratory environment with lots of ambient noise (pumps, fans, equipment running). When I double tap the left earbud to switch from 0 -> max noise cancellation, it's like I'm turning off the world around me. I can audibly hear every background noise vanish. Add to that music or a podcast for some active noise in the ear, and you can barely hear anything.The sound quality, to me, is excellent. That said, I know Bose has a specific equalizer tuning that Bose newcomers might not like, or aren't used to. They sound different (not worse of better) than competing mid/high-end offerings from the likes of Sony and Sennheiser. Worth keeping in mind. The Bluetooth connectivity is excellent (damn-near perfect) because Bose FINALLY moved to Bluetooth 5.1, and it makes a big difference.The battery life is decent. I can almost get through a full day of work on one charge. The charging case makes recharging very easy, though, so whenever they do die, one can simply forget about them for ~1 hour in their case, and they're good as new. With battery tech moving forward rapidly, I would expect the gen. 2 QuietComfort Earbuds, whenever released, to have a >8 hour run time. That would be a 5-star battery life IMO.One word of caution. It seems that the battery life indicator on the charging case is a little.. dumb. There are 5 LEDs to indicate remaining battery (5 = full, 1 = almost empty) but my charging case reaches empty with 3 lights remaining. Perhaps a calibration problem.

i do not recommand, like everyone else, they started flashing red and white and they stop working after 1 year, do not buy, they will give you 20% off for the same earpuds or the version 2. dont do it. since they got purchase by the new owners, bose is completly useless. bad compagny now.Sounds good tho

I like that additional ear pieces were thrown. But the software was garbage where one had to provide email info AND 126 Mb download. Software was USELESS. I was hoping they'd include audio software but NO.

I need these buds due to noise sensitivity. However immediately after using them sharp ringing in my ears and head have ramped ip so loudly it’s difficult to function or sleep. I stopped using them and weeks later the ringing reduced dramatically. I tried the buds again (without music just for noise reduction) and the same horrible high-pitch ringing returned. I can’t get through on the 800 number. Customer Service: Any idea if I can return these?
Good quality earbuds but randomly they make a ear piercing screeching sound for no reason at all for like a couple of seconds

reviewTitle: You are on your own with this product
reviewDescription: Bose closed its stores in Canada . You are left to fend for yourself if you run into difficulty. No instruction booklet with the product . You have to access their website and request one . Even with the booklet you have to deal with a defective app which controls the item . You need to access the settings menu on the app to activate the product . I cannot access the settings menu . Therefore apart from connecting the buds to my cell phone , I cannot access the features . Bose has proven to be penny wise and pound foolish . Buy a cheaper earbud . Great disappointment with the product . SHAME BOSE ! I returned the product !

reviewTitle: Good ANC, but bad user experience.
reviewDescription: Pro:  Best ANC in TWS.  Sound quality is above average.Con:  No multi points support. I can’t believe it, qc30/35 all have it, but bose removed this excellent feature for qc earbuds.  Extremely slow to switch devices, you have to manually disconnect from first device and manually connect it to the other from bluetooth setting, and it takes 5-7 sec to connect which is too slow.  Big charging case, not easy to carry in pockets.  Voice prompt is choppy.  Can only make calls with right buds(Seriously? its 2020)  Bose music app is buggy and you MUST sign up to use the app.  Buds are bit large, not suitable for working out.Overall, very disappointed. I have been waiting this products for 2 years. I started using bose since qc15, they can make way better products, qc earbuds cannot justify the price tag.
Used them for maybe 3 months then lost them is a drawer for a year found them last week and one earbud dosnt work

The positives:-Very comfortable buds in your ear, soft and light, you can wear them for hours happily.-Above and beyond sound quality, it is Bose after all.-You can change your settings to what YOU like.The negatives:-HUGE case, this might as well have wheels .. seriously enormous, very impractical.-NOT completely noise cancelling... I really was hoping to block out all the annoying people who speak loudly, but this does nothing for that, I still have to listen to them at work/commute on the train and this was THE WHOLE REASON I bought them.Like I said I do love the sound quality and how gentle they are in the ear but.. I'm not at all convinced that the price matches the product... Returning.Do not get your hopes up with the noise cancellation like I did.

Day 2 - right ear buds stopped connecting and no matter what I did , they would not reconnect. Also the LED indicator was was funky (as per picture). The Bose website does not have a description for the mix of indicators I was seeing. I was offered a replacement but for earbuds to suddenly disconnect after 2 days of very mild use, I think I'll go with a different brand.The noise cancelling feature was really goo! I didn't think the sound quality was the best based on comparing previous high end earbuds I've had in the past.

reviewTitle: Just meh, quality doesn't match price bracket
reviewDescription: I realize there are people who review items just to complain about the price of a product but that isn't the point I am trying to make.Basically, in my humble opinion, these earbuds should not have a bose logo on them, they are average at best and the value for the dollar seems like a rip-off compared to other earbuds with similar designs.The noise cancellation is really weak, sound quality is just okay.If you are looking for earbuds I recommend researching other brands, if you just want noise-cancelling and don't care if they are earbuds or headphones I would recommend the bose quiet comfort 35's.I would have expected much better from Bose

I got this set to use in the office and it was on sale on Amazon. It has been couple of months that I have these ear buds and work perfectly.  The battery life of the casing and the buds is really good and I never had an issue with not having enough charge. The set up and the app was easy to install and use.The audio quality is very good and is clear. The negatives of this set are:The noise cancellation is not that great, but  I guess for the price range is acceptable. The buttons are a bit difficult to get used to. It happened several times that I wanted to adjust them in my ear while on a telecom meeting and it dropped the call, or when I want to adjust the volume it switches from noise canceling to normal setting. It could be my problem only and other users can get used to it better, after all I was born in the sixties and somehow considered technologically impaired! But overall I highly recommend this set of earbuds if you are looking for a set below $200.

I'm giving it rate 4 instead of 5 for missing wireless charging. I understand it has USB-C, still... wireless charging is much more comfortable when you put it to charge on same charging pad as apple airpods pro instead of charging cable dangling on your desk. When you are OCD or hate cables on the desk you will understand what I'm talking about.Sound quality is not in the discussion. It's just perfect. And if you buy them for doing workout at the gym you will not regret it.

reviewTitle: No charging block, very short usb-c cable
reviewDescription: The earbuds themselves were easy to pair and work well, but giving this 4 out of 5 stars because I was disappointed that it doesn’t come with a charging block (unfortunately, the new standard, I suppose) and the charging cord is too short to be of much use. Otherwise, happy with the product.

I recently acquired the Beats Studio Buds, and they've proven to be an excellent addition to my daily routine. I've been using them during my shifts at a school cafeteria, and they've been a godsend for keeping distractions at bay while maintaining fantastic audio quality. The pass-through feature is a notable highlight, allowing me to stay aware of my surroundings.In terms of sound quality, I've found them to be quite impressive. These earbuds don't deliver a flat sound signature, but rather a dynamic V-curve that many users appreciate. The bass and treble balance is particularly enjoyable.Another notable advantage of these earbuds is their compact and lightweight design. For those who prefer not to wear AirPod Pros, the Beats Studio Buds are a great alternative. They're comfortable and easy to wear for extended periods, making them a solid choice for both work and leisure. I highly recommend them to anyone seeking a balance of style, sound quality, and convenience in their daily listening experience.
Pairing the earbuds was easy enough, but the sound quality is very subpar.

Okay so I’ve used these headphones the past 3 days pretty consistently, 45 minutes cardio in the AM, 90 minutes in the gym and THEY are great.. BUT, it seems there may be quality issues as my left EarPod sounds like a frog croaking from time to time.. I’m not sure why and how but I’m just hoping that sorts itself out cause they’re brand now.Sound cancelling and transparency at the click of a button was a great idea and makes day to day use very simple. Lots of bass and a very surround sound experience otherwise. Love the beats, would recommend!

This is absolutely best valued year phones on the market! They are good but I don’t like the connection Between multiple devisesI have ran through 4 pairs of AirPods as I use them 24/7 but these have been keeping up so farBattery is good just takes long to charge
Entraînement
J aime la qualité sonore et les beats tiennent bien dans les oreilles

reviewTitle: It's good but not that good
reviewDescription: So I had these earbuds for around 3months and here are my thoughts.-They pair pretty well to my android phone and they give you the info you need like battery on the buds and on the case, which I really appreciate.-Sound quality wise they are a bit bassy but that's what you get for the beats sound signature.-the app is okay... They give the option to toggle between modes like transparency and ANC, customize your earbuds name's and that's pretty much it and nothing more . There's no eq settings which I would honestly love but eh whatever no big problem, they are already good sounding but you know I like my customization.-ANC and transparency mode.ANC is acceptable, as a student I would like to have the noise of my classroom just to disappear but these they definitely block out noise from a far but they don't really cancel much if it's too loud or a bit more up close they are acceptable. They are like if you dunk your head underwater, you definitely can't hear people from a far but from up close and near you, you can definitely hear it.Transparency mode is such a disappointment, it's just make everything sound fuzzy and you can't hear voice if someone talking to you while playing music. Which I think is what transparency mode was meant to do, to play music and hear everything around your environment but these fail at that they are just disappointing.-other tidbitsControl is super nice, the button are tactile which honestly is better than touch control in my opinion. Of course when you press the button, you are jamming the buds deeper into your ear which did make it uncomfortable here and thereYou can't really control your volume from the earbuds and you have to do it manually by your phone or smartwatch or whatever.So yeah, thank you for reading and hope this is good enough guide for your purchasing decisions. They are really good and they might come with slight inconvenience but they are not terrible. They do the job especially for this price range

reviewTitle: All-Around Not What You Expect When Spending 200 Dollars
reviewDescription: As far as the sound quality goes, the earbuds are pretty good. Everything else, JESUS CHRIST. Perhaps my biggest gripe with this product was the battery life. I would come into work everyday at 9am with these earbuds fully charged and by noon they were dead. Sometimes sooner. 3 Hours? That is insane. The microphone quality is unusable. Nobody I spoke to on the phone could hear me and that was one of the main reasons I bought wireless earbuds. It got better as time went on, but for the first week or two, I had serious issues with connecting these earbuds to my phone. Last but not least, the build quality of the case is abysmal. Everytime I dropped the case, the ear buds would fly out of it and I'd have to find them on the floor. This happened at least a dozen times (I'm a klutz I know). There's no seal or safety clip that fastens the earbuds into the case. Just a very cheap magnet that holds them in place. Again, not what you expect when you spend this much money on a pair of earbuds. In conclusion, I took it as a sign that when I dropped the case again and the earbuds flew so far away that to this day I can only find one, that I should have refunded this product within a week of getting it but I decided to give it a chance. It's pretty obvious that after Apple acquired Beats that they want to run a monopoly on the wireless earbud market by forcing everyone to get AirPods for 300 dollars so even if you spend 200 dollars, the product won't be fully optimized on purpose for iOs. Maybe I got a bad batch but that's no excuse for a multi trillion dollar company. Don't recommend. Either buy AirPods or some other brand entirely.

Got them out the box and they didn’t work like I had the volume all the way down on mute and sound would still come out and had them all the way up and was almost whisper quiet, found a YouTube video fixing the problem that says just re pair them while holding down the middle button and they do work now but the noise cancelling does duck all same with transparency just does f all can use them with none on and work fine just makes me upset, plus if you keep them on noise cancelling or transparency and put them back in the case they make a screeching noise unless you take them out and personally put them on off mode, want to return them but don’t want to pay money, I wanted to like em but absolute garbage

reviewTitle: These emit a constant white noise hum, it will drive you nuts.
reviewDescription: I was happy to get noise-cancelling and spacial audio ear buds under 150$. However, when I started using them, I realized these earbuds emit a low-volume white noise at all times. I do a lot of guided meditations, so it drove me crazy to hear a hum all the time. I read some forum comments from others who experience this, so I don't think it's a faulty pair. The sound quality is also simply mediocre, and the noise-cancelling is ok, nothing great. I returned them immediately and now I'm gonna save up for a better quality pair.

Had these useless things for a month. Total waste of money. I just ordered some AirPods to replace these terrible little devices and, so too should you get off this Beats train. Beats are uncomfortable, they fall out, the button interaction feels cheap and is inefficient, useless for jamming along with tunes,  the sound is nothing special, and I've had several instances where only one of the two Beats Buds connect to my phone - remarkably annoying. Total garbage. Save your money or get those AirPods you're considering. Total garbage. I rated these awful things one star only because there was no zero star option. Thank you and good night.

Save yourself the money. These are TERRIBLE!! And if you want to return them, they charge YOU to do so. The sound is garbage and they constantly crack no matter how low you turn them down. If you have small ears like me, no matter what size you change the ear piece to they CONSTANTLY fall out!! I’ve lost them on walks, at the gym. The side buttons are annoying because I’m constantly trying to get them to stay in my ears and it’s always turning the music on and off.

reviewTitle: Apple is Apple.  This ain't it.
reviewDescription: No matter what anyone says, Apple is Apple.  Having AirPods I wanted to upgrade to a noise cancelling earbuds, compatible with iPhone.  These Beats seemed like a good solution as they are owned by Apple.The basic functions of Beats are not equal to basic functions AirPods.  Automatic stop play when removed one or fast forward does not exists. Discomfort in the ear from a prolong use was also noticeable.  These also had a very happy connection - not fun when listening to podcast, and the microphone was not of best quality.  I've returned these after just a few days of usage and upgraded to AirPods Pro 2nd gen. Best decision ever.side note. Returning extended warranty through Amazon is a hassle.  I will continue buying household and personal things on Amazon but will resort to Costco and other retailers when it comes to electronics.

purchased these to use in a noisy environment for 5 minute calls (one call ever few days)  Others could not hear me well enough and it was not cancelling the noise to be able to hear. I am not happy with these devices overall.If just using while walking then they would be ok.

You can find better earbuds from other companies for similar price like sony c700n that sound much better overall and also their surround/spatial audio is better too. Studio buds are not that reliable in quality either as they only last for about a year before they start sounding bad

reviewTitle: Bought New Beats but recieved a used pair!
reviewDescription: I purchased a set of new Beats but clearly recieved a used pair. The case was scrated up and when I paired with my phone the air buds were already named/customized with the previous user's name. I did not purchase a refurbished set of headphones.

reviewTitle: Better than Wires; However, do NOT go with this brand!
reviewDescription: I had the Samsung, 1st Generation for the past 3 years and I must say I miss them dearly. I lost the right earbud so I had no choice but to get new ones. I hate all the newer Samsung earbuds as the quality of sound is horrible. The sound of the Beats are pretty good, definitely louder than the Samsung. However, I find that the battery life isn't great as well as the feel inside of the actual ear but other than, that I have no complaints!6 MONTH UPDATEThese earbuds are unbelievably trash and a waste of my money. I wish to God that I never bought these. They die too quickly and they don't stay in your ears. You can't even workout with them much less take a walk without them falling out regardless of how many times you change the size of the cushion in the ear. I wish I could return them but it's past 6 months now. I'm about to spend money to get Samsung earbuds because I cannot be bothered. Long story short DO NOT purchase these earbuds.

Could have given it a 4 stars. A couple of things:1. Last week I bought one pair for my partner as she wanted a pair of ANC buds. I ordered a grey colour, and it works fine she says the ACN is ok too. So I bought another pair for myself on May 9 2023. I went for the black colour and I can tell most ppl will get black too. Upon receipt of the black one, things went to a different direcions. The buds battery was dead (0% on the case and the right bud), this said the buds had been used and then returned, as my gfs paired with with the phone instantly when opening the box. After charging for about 5 min, I paired it with my iPhone, and the warranty says expires on Mar 26, 2024. so this proved that it had been returned, at least once.2. After wearing it for a couple of hours, I noticed UNUSUALLY loud white noise, I understand it's normal to have white noise on ACN earphones, I also owned Bose QC30, I get it, but this beats buds, it's like someone screaming, literally, in your ears, it almost covered the music playing. I googled it and saw many similar issues. I also reset the buds like listed on its website. After that, the volume turned way too low, even I turn my volume settings to the maximum, I still can barely hear it. So I returned it and left a sticker in the package letting them know do not sell it to another person. It's broken. 3. Today (May 10,2023), I received a replacement from beats, and this pair has also been returned as the battery is also dead when pairing, but may be less than a month's ago as it's still eligible for apple care plus ( eligible in the first 60 days), luckily the white noise level is normal on this new pair and I will keep it. I understand free return is Amazon's policy, but quality control is really poor on beats end too. Overall, the sound quality and ACN is fair, worth the discounted price, but I will not recommend it if it's the full price. And go for the other colours, like grey, dont buy black or white, as it's very likely to be a returend one!!!!

reviewTitle: Overall good but some small inconveniences
reviewDescription: The buds sound good to me and the pairing process is easy and 99% of the time when I take them out of the case they pair to my iPhone flawlessly the other 1% of the time I have to press the button to get it to turn on which is annoying. When the case battery level is low it keeps showing a notification with the battery level every five seconds until you charge it or put the earbuds back even if they are fully charged which seems unnecessary. It’s also hard to check the battery level of the case because sometimes it brings up the card with the battery levels when you open the case but other times it doesn’t even when the case is left open for a couple of seconds. The battery widget in the notification tray only shows the battery level of the case for a few seconds so you have to be quick when checking it otherwise it disappears. Other than those issues I like the earbuds because they have the find my feature and the sound quality and noise isolation are good enough for me, especially when I listen to spatial audio songs on Apple Music. These came with a free trial to that which is kind

reviewTitle: Good for a couple weeks, now will not hold charge.
reviewDescription: These earbuds served me very well for around 12 weeks. The noise cancellation works pretty good, transparency mode is quite useful. The problem I've been having is charging. After snapping the earbuds into the magnetic case, the light on the case will not turn red to indicate charging. After many attempts of putting the earbuds in and out of the case, ONE earbud will charge and one will be completely dead. I'm certain the pair I've received were brand new so I'm not sure why I am experiencing this problem.

reviewTitle: Keep falling out of my ears
reviewDescription: I have small ears so I use with the small ear tips but still keeps falling out. Let alone working out, just normal walking makes it falls out all the time. Other than that I like noise cancelling, battery performance and sound quality.

reviewTitle: Horrible Bluetooth Range, but good sound
reviewDescription: Good sound and decent noise cancelling, however really poor Bluetooth range, 10-15ft max before they lost connection. Would not recommend if you are like me and like to roam phone free while listening to music

Le son est bon, cependant, il faut un temps d'adaptation pour les mettre correctement. De plus, je constate que la batterie d'un  des écouteurs s'use plus vite. Je réfléchis à les renvoyer du coup. À voir

Did a lot of research on various earbuds and decided to go with these. After using for a few days I think Ill be returning them because the flaws with phone functionality are too severeFit: a lot of reviewers said they fit better than any other earbud theyve tried. They do fit well but after being in my ears for 15-20 minutes they feel like they need to be pushed back in again. Ive tried different tip sizes and this is with the ones that feel like they fit the best.Noise Cancellation: Not the best, and not overly noticeable compared to when nothing is activeTransparency Mode: Works wellMicrophone: Have had numerous people say they cant hear or understand me when using these for phone calls and had to talk on my phone normally insteadPairing: Very easy to use. Have connected with multiple devices and can switch between them easily. Will connect automatically when buds removed from caseFeatures: Can use either earbud individually which is nice. Only way to see the case battery life is by putting a battery widget on your phone and having the case lid open. Would be nice if there was a way to bring up the graphic that shows both earpods and case + their battery life like what shows up when your pairing them with your phone.Phone: I ended several calls unintentionally while trying to push the earbuds back into my ears because the entire outside surface is a big button and a single press will hang up. Very frustrating when this happens after being on hold for 20 minutes.Sound: Decent

reviewTitle: The are just okay, not worth the price.
reviewDescription: The fit is great, the connectivity with an iPhone was good, (a few minor issues), they look good and you can see the beats logo. 👍The transparent mode is reasonably good, I could understand speech and it wasn’t overly loud.The sound is acceptable, not mind blowing and didn’t have the low end I was expecting from a beats product.Battery life is reasonable, I didn’t time it but seemed to match the claims. One of the cases didn’t seem to hold a charge and may have been defective. I ordered these twice, see below for the why.The ANC (active noise cancelling) is actually the worst part of these, I couldn’t tell if ANC was on. There was no perceivable change in ambient sound between ANC on and off.I am comparing these against the Tazo NC7 (maybe half the price), and the beats are far inferior in everything but appearance and ease of use with an iPhone.The final straw, so to speak, is that Amazon couldn’t supply me with a proof of purchase with my units serial number. Without this you can’t get apple+ care. I even purchased the combo with the apple+ care (twice) and called Amazon and apple (many hours) and no resolution other than to return them. 👎 do better Amazon.So back to Amazon they went.The final good thing is that Amazon takes returns for 30 days… so you can buy a bunch and pick what works for you and return the rest. 👍🔥

Pros-Sound has thump to it unlike AirPods pro 2-They fit comfortablyCons-really poor anc (noise cancellation)-software buggy on iOS 15.2 (won’t switch to transparency mode and will jump back to noise cancellation mode)-buttons on earpieces are sensitive. So wearing a winter hat that covers the ears will disrupt audio and pause it, etc..-earpieces awkwardly poke out and don’t sit flush with ears.Overall, its ok. Not perfect, but good enough!

reviewTitle: Difficultés de connexion avec Iphone 8 - Pairing difficulties with iphone 8
reviewDescription: Plus :- Son de très bonne qualité- Durée de vie des batteries correcte- Suppression du bruit ambiant appréciableMoins :- Alors que les Beats sont fabriqués par Apple, il est parfois difficile de les connecter avec un iphone. Il faut ouvrir le boitier des écouteurs à plusieurs reprises pour que ça fonctionne. La connexion n’est pas immédiate bien que l’appareil soit reconnu et affiché en 3D. Le casque se déconnecte parfois aussitôt connecté.- Si vous les portez en position couché sur le côté, pour vous endormir ou relaxer par exemple, le bouton tel qu’il est placé, entre en contact avec l’oreiller et arrête la lecture.- Micro coupures ponctuelles lors d’un jogging.

reviewTitle: Great sound and ease of use
reviewDescription: The only thing I don’t like is they fall out of my ears a bit to easy even with the smallest fit rings but otherwise great sound and connectivity is a breeze!
Great earbuds. Comfy, snug. Sound quality is top notch. Like the size. Highly recommended!

These earbuds are great for the price, I would recommend them. They have most of the features of Apples Airpods Pros but at a lower price. However the bass on these are insane and may be a deal breaker for some people, but personally I like bass in my music.They really deserve 5 starsEdit: I had to call Apple to update the warranty status of these earbuds since when I got them they only had about 7 months of warranty left and they should have 1 year of warranty. That may be a fluke and only happened to me but, I think its worth mentioning this.
Got these for my daughter for Christmas. She loves them , especially the noise cancelling feature.

This of course would change from person to person as the shape of the ear plays a big factor in this, though after losing my Apple AirPods Pro, I have decided to buy this model instead of AirPods and personally the noise cancelling on these are superior. The audio quality is also identical, if not better, to AirPods. Overall, a great product.
great quality for the price.all the the case lid is perfect and tight the only issue is the bottom is round so it doesn't stand on it's own properly and lid closes when you don't want it too.
Love these beauties. Have become my go-to for working out in gym.

reviewTitle: Beats Studio Buds – True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds
reviewDescription: I gave it as a gift to my daughter. It is very easy to use; it matches well with Apple phones, and the most important thing is that the sound quality is very good!

reviewTitle: Almost as good as the Apple buds
reviewDescription: Almost as good as the Apple buds
Great value

The sounds is great on these , but the build quality of the earbuds is low mid at best . The edge where the 2 halves of the earbuds are put together didn’t line up which left one side with a sharp edge that would dig into my ear and seriously irritate my ear after just 10 minutes . Even after filing it down smooth with 3000 grit sandpaper to even out the edges, it didn’t help too much with the comfort of these . Wouldn’t waste time or money with these .

reviewTitle: Charge lasts about 4 .1/2 hours only..and sounds like tin cans..
reviewDescription: After all the hype about Beats I finally caved and spent the money to be TRULY disappointed ..First , they sound like two cans on a string  ..I did discover if you push the ear plugs far enough into your ear you can hear a bit of Bass ..but I can feel them stabbing my brain  ..it hurts to be in that far and they don't stay ..don't cough or talk ..you'll have to re screw them back into your ear  further causing discomfort..Sorry ..I expected so much more from these ..They came with NO charge and the battery dies in about 4 to 4 1/2 hrs ..it takes an hour to charge in the case ..I believe these may be DUDS ..but if this company is so special How Dare they send  Returned pods without bringing them back up to factory specs. At least check them...shakes head* I will be returning..

Quite disappointing earbuds. Its okay for music but really horrible for calls in a noisy place. The person on the other end can hear all the noise in the environment which makes communication difficult.
I’m not getting the playback hours.Simple as that, max 4 hours for a full charge in earbuds and case. This is with ANC on.Not satisfied with this product only because of the power backup.
These earbuds do not stay in place while I exercise. They kept falling down. So, I ended up without music for my training session. Everyting else is good.

Honestly I bought these as a replacement to my lost air pod pros v1 which are great an dont need any improvements but these beats honestly have missed their mark. Can't listen to them for more then a hour before they need recharged an if you have them at full volume for anymore then a song the right ear buds starts to crackle an makes the music unbalanced an gives you a migraine. The included ear bud sizes with the smallest of ear none of them avtually fit or create a good seal. If I knew how to return a product I would an spend tue extra 60 bucks to get the air pod pros again

reviewTitle: Don't buy these earbuds from amazon
reviewDescription: I bought these earbuds from amazon, and they seemed fine at first, but not even a week later I start to notice the flaws in them. I can't go more than 15ft from my phone without them cutting in and out, and the sound quality is terrible, considering that beats are known to be great for their bass and audio. I'm really disapointed in these, and will be switching to airpod pros.
i have had to charge these every second day even if i am not using them. i expected a better battery life  for the price of these.
Pros:  good noise cancelling  decent  battery life  affordable for quality earbudsCons:  sound cuts in and out frequently  which is kind of annoying

reviewTitle: Perfect for the gym, no bueno for conversation.
reviewDescription: The sound is good, great noise cancellation. If you try to have a conversation, no one the line will hear what you're saying, aside from scratchy muffled sounds. Battery life is annoying because one side finishes before the other. Which makes no sense because they're charged together. I don't regret it considering they keep my hands free when I'm training!

Got these for Christmas. The extra tips won’t click on properly, the AirPods wouldn’t connect to the phone and when they finally did, the screen that popped up wasn’t the proper screen and “AirPods pro de Gabriel R” popped up as if someone else had already owned them. Not impressed.

When I opened the Amazon box I saw the seal on the AirPods box was already opened and when I opened the box the AirPods didn’t worked and looked used this means Amazon is selling used products as new ones
Product is fine but if you are looking for a refund this comes direct from Apple so they charge you for return then take 2-3 weeks to credit you back.

reviewTitle: IT'S NOT NEW! AND THE DESCRIPTION DOESN'T SAY IT! IT'S A FRAUD!
reviewDescription: It is not new, it wasn't correctly sealed, but it costs like new!!! The box is dirty and looks awful, and it wasn't even covered with protection in a huge box when delivered! It's a fraud
Shipping box is completely fine but inner product damaged.
Garbage

Sometimes one side doesn't charge. Tried cleaning the case and the connectors and it kept happening, after taking them under warranty to an Apple Store, after 4 days they told me they couldn't reproduce the error and returned as it is. Really disappointing service, not a good value for money for sure. I would recommend spending your money elsewhere.
This is very bad product
I didn’t like the product

Apparently AirPod Pros are not fully compatible with iPhone models 11 and earlier.  For example, they won't show up in the "findmy" app,  the charge status does not display automatically when you open the case, and custom settings such as transparency get lost.  It took 3 consultations with Apple to figure this out :(Its back to the original AirPod (which I love) for this user.
Not as described

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviewDescription: I have to preface this by saying I'm an Apple fan. Have been since about '91. Love their products and service and use them for day to day work. I've own a pair of 1st gen AirPods for the last few years and they've started losing their recharge capacity. I decoded to get a nice AirPods Pro 2nd gen to treat myself. The product itself was nicely packaged, had extra ear insert fittings and a USB-c cable.I wore them in trying our sound quality for a movie and the Spatial reproduction was astounding. You'd move your head and the direction of the sound kept with the source (TV).But when I work them for a Zoom meeting using the noise cancelling, I noticed something that I didn't think would bother me. I couldn't hear my own voice when talking. It wasn't completely drowned out but very muffled. Didn't like that at all since it threw my off my game.The second issue that arose was after about an hour of wearing them I could feel them pressing against the inside chamber of my ear in a way that was painful. I compared the size of the Airpod Pros tot holder model and they are so much bigger. Just want to make sure everyone is aware of this size difference and if  you have a smaller size ear chamber to borrow a friends before purchasing. I ended up returning and buying the regular AirPods 2nd gen.

reviewTitle: Dont buy AirPods for working out
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviewDescription: Hands down worst earbuds for working out. I’ve had many pairs of the different generation AirPods over the years because they’re the cool thing to get but I’m finally done with them. They fall out of your ears easy but that’s not even the worst part. God forbid you sweat in them a little bit because they’ll stop charging in their case. I even have the case for the case and the cleaning kit but it doesn’t matter. You’ll find yourself taking them out and putting them in over and over again trying to get the earbuds to connect to their case and start charging. Also you’ll forget about this major flaw and get to the gym just to open the case and have dead earbuds. Haven’t even had this set long and they’re already messed up. I don’t know if this is an issue without the sweat so if you don't intend to workout with them then they might be fine. But if you do then get a different brand.

reviewTitle: My lightning Airpod Pro 2's were MUCH louder.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviewDescription: I bought the lightning Airpoid Pro 2's over a year ago and LOVED them, but my new puppy decided to chew them up, so I needed to buy a new pair.  Now that the USB-C charging version is available, I decided to buy these.  I read plenty of reviews and many people said they are comparable or better, but that's not been my experience.You see, I like to listen to my music LOUD.  My previous set of lightning Airpod Pro 2's excelled in that department, so I expected great things from the USB-C version.  Unfortunately, the USB-C versions don't get nearly as loud...
