I'd say they can achieve 70% of the volume level.  I also don't feel the sound quality is as good.  Overall, I'm quite disappointed.  Perhaps I got a bad pair, so I may try returning them and reordering a new pair.

reviewTitle: I like the AirPods Pro 1st generation better
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviewDescription: I've had more problems with the second generation in a couple months than I had with the first generation in two years. I use them for noise cancellation in a wood shop. Nothing crazy loud. They usually do fine, but if anyone uses an air nozzle to blow off their bench within 30 feet of me it blows up my ears with loud static. They've also had a har time with staying connected to my phone. Like if an alarm goes off on my phone while I'm listening to any audio it disconnects my headphones. This stuff didn't happen with my old headphones. Super annoying. I do however like being able to turn down the volume by lightly molesting my headphones, but again this is spotty and has created another issue where the headphones don't know if I'm trying to pause the music or just turn the volume down so it just does nothing.

reviewTitle: The Fit is a big problem and the Noise Cancellation Poor
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviewDescription: Despite coming with four different ear bud coverings, the fit is a big problem.  The pods always seem on the verge of falling out unless I sit still.  I run the built in test and one pod always says it needs adjustment, and after four different coverings it still does.  Sometimes, on the third test the other pod, which gets a green light, changes to orange and says it does not fit.  So much for the test.  The noise cancellation is a joke and even then only when playing continuous music.  Any sound with pauses or breaks and background noise sounds as if there were no pods at all.  I would have sent them back had I been decisive within the time frame allotted.  Overpriced and underperforming.

reviewTitle: Not compatible with 7th gen iPod Nano
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviewDescription: Apparently, I did not perform adequate due diligence on this product as a search of the questions seems to indicate compatibility but a check of Apples compatibility chart after the fact show that AirPods Pro are only compatible with the iPod Touch. Even then, having tested this I can attest that they do pair and playing music works, at least until you pause or fast forward, then nothing but silence and the only way to get music/sound in the earbuds is to disconnect/reconnect via Bluetooth. Returns for this item are a nightmare as Amazon wants me to perform a reset but I have no iOS devices capable of performing such an action! Customer service is being less than helpful as UPS Pickup is the only option available for return!

reviewTitle: A review said that these were superior to the Hearphones by Bose
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviewDescription: I loved the audio sound of music but the Transparency is either less effective OR the directions on using it were not clear in activating it.  I spent time on the phone with an Apple Support person who was working with a list of instructions provided for her that should have been made public so that people could have them and follow them.  It appears you must go to three different unrelated screens to active Transparency.  With the Bose you can hear clearly birds and your surroundings, not possible to the degree I expected from my experience with the AirPod.

reviewTitle: Product falls out. Pods Don't fit. Beware
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviewDescription: They fall out no matter which size ear tips I use.I do not have outsized or particularly abnormal ears.Product is not fit for purpose, or should come with a warning that there is a high risk they will be useless to a very large part of the population.I took them on an overseas trip, and it’s been an exercise in frustration. I’ll either have to try and return them or investigate some aftermarket solution which seems to be big business for this failed product
Sound quality and noise cancellation is a huge upgrade over the AirPod Pro 1s, but mic quality suffers at times, and there are persistent glitches with random volume increases.

reviewTitle: Microphone is not that good, people won’t be able to hear you very well
reviewDescription: Other than the microphone everything else is very good.
While the noise cancellation is much improved over the 1st generation, the audio quality is just okay. The glossy case still gets easily scratched as before.
Pas assez puissant au niveau du son.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviewDescription: You would think apple would design a better product but idk… the sound quality is very acceptable for me. They improved a bit, and all the processing it does with anc and transparency is quite impressive… so convient with iPhone and Mac. The anc is jaw dropping.. WHEN YOU ACTUALLY SHOVE THEM IN YOUR EARS AND GET A PROPER SEAL!The design is seriously atrocious, they look great but gravity wants these earbuds badly… 90% of the time they are actually on the floor!I do have odd shaping in my ears so I usually need foam tips or something around that line. Welp those don’t work either…. I ordered the foam masters for the gen 2s and they are actually worse than the stock ones. Can only get about 1-3 min of seal with the eartips supplied with the earbuds before they fall out. No bueno. At all. Makes me want to return them but everything else is so convenient about them. Hopefully the little bumpers I ordered will help keep them in my ears! Otherwise they r being returned. Maybe I’ll consider if they redesign them completely. Also the sound quality is very acceptable for me… but anything past 70% vol sounds atrocious, I guess that’s understandable.Lover volumes using Apple Music they sounds great and the spatial sounds very open and expansive, indeed like the sounds is coming from the phone with “iPhone tracked” (low to mid vol)  and fixed mode makes them sound like headphones. Very far and expansive I’m forgetting the term rn lol.EditIt’s been a few weeks and they are great imo…. Just the 1….1 thing I think that these need is a bass booster setting. They sound great and they have a good amount of bass but it’s very neutral … especially the adaptive sound wizard, makes sure it sounds completely flat. Some super heavy bass songs like some 2010 Gucci or nipsey slaps on these… truly shines , but it’s only certain EDM n hip hop tracks. While they do sound heavy… a bass boost setting would be killer. And also of course… a redesign on the ear tips with some sort of material that sticks to your ear…. Not slip out!!

reviewTitle: AirPods Pro Gen 2 After AirPods Gen 1 Impressions
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviewDescription: I have owned a pair of basic AirPods lightning charging for several years, and they are starting to lose battery life. I never liked wired Apple headphones. They hurt my ears and would not stay in. The AirPods were basically flawless. I just wanted more on-bud controls and noise cancelling. Enter AirPods Pro. I was super excited to treat myself to upgraded headphones. I love my Bose QC45 over the ear for sound quality and noise cancelling, but as a glasses wearer, they hurt my ears and head so bad after a short time. After having the AirPods Pro for a few weeks, I can't help but feel a little sad that they will not stay in my ears. I am using the biggest silicone tips. They gradually work themselves out of my ear and fall off my head. This is just sitting at my desk. If I have a snack or eat lunch, they come out quicker. One thing that has helped somewhat is cleaning them and my ear canal with an alcohol wipe every day before use. I think everything is great about the AirPods Pro except for the fit. I didn't know there were other tips, so I guess I will search for foam to see if those will stay in my ears. So far, meeting attendees have told me my audio is perfect.

reviewTitle: Sound Quality is Excellent, Noise Cancellation Quite Good, Fit is Awful
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviewDescription: The sound on these is really fantastic -- I was hearing elements for the first time in songs I've probably listened to dozens of times. The noise cancellation is impressive, but tends to lend a sort of metallic, crunchy note to sounds that make it through, which for me has a kind of nails-on-blackboard effect; overall the cancellation is good enough to outweigh that issue.The only real problem with these is that the fit is awful. I find myself readjusting them (screwing them back into my ear canal to reseal the fit) every 5-10 minutes, and if I wear them under a beanie it's worse. If I'm chewing or talking, the movement of the muscles around my ear is actually enough to make them fall out completely. I've tried a couple of different tips and this problem is persistent, even though the tips fit well enough to pass the pods seal test. At this price point, bad fit is totally unacceptable, and I'm pretty annoyed at Apple for not correcting the design substantially in this second generation. I'm currently looking at custom molded tips, which will turn these into more like $400+ headphones and make them much more obnoxious to charge. It's a solution, but not a reasonable one.

reviewTitle: really good earbuds but terrible on windows
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviewDescription: I really loved these earbuds. The hard plastic on the eartips that snaps onto the earbud is so ingenious. Personally, I don't like eartips because I need to hear my surroundings, but these eartips are so comfortable. You can wear them without the eartips, and they are just as great. One thing, though, is why did they choose the most slippery material, lmao?Now, the reason I returned these earbuds is because they are not Windows PC-friendly. I've tried everything from updating and changing drivers to almost every troubleshooting and CMD option out there. I even let a support agent take control of my PC to try to fix the problem, but nothing fixed the terrible audio glitching. It's so bad that the earbuds are unusable on Windows PCs.So, I really think Apple made the AirPods Pro 2 perform terribly on non-Apple devices on purpose. That is such a scummy tactic, and I hope the EU spanks Apple for it like they did for the charging port. Greedy company, but great hardware. Not a fan of the software, though.

reviewTitle: Better than I thought, but defective  within a week.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviewDescription: I initially ordered a Sony WX 1000XM5 and was very pleased with the sound and customization. However, the foam ear pieces were abrasive and ill fitting.  This caused the earbuds to lose their seal and eventually fall out. Additionally, the connectivity to my iPhone 14 Pro Max was intermittent.I then ordered a pair of AirPod Pros 2nd generation. The sound quality was close to the Sonys and new features were a pleasant surprise. I am coming from an AirPod Pro 1st generation. Unfortunately, within the first week of use, the right earbud has developed VERY LOUD ear drum damaging static and is unusable. I will return and get another pair, but probably directly from Apple this time.  Why is Amazon $50 cheaper than Apple? Do I have a repackaged return?

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviewDescription: Sound: 5/10. There is no comparison to a good iem in the same price bracket. It's okay, right in the middle of the pack for sound quality. Its vocal frequencies are better than its bass/treble.Utility: 10/10. Absolutely amazing active noise cancelling, pass through, and quality of life features.Fit: 7/10. They're light and comfortable, but fall out over time. I tried all the tips and some aftermarket ones. The stock tips are best. You'll need to adjust them every 30min to keep a good fit.For music, I'd never choose these.But I wear these more often than any other iem. The utility and ease of use makes up for its lack of sound quality. If you have an iOS device, it's a game changer.

Great wireless earbuds with noise cancelling that “just work” if you’re using them with an Apple device. I can pop these out whenever needed and they’re good to go.The noise cancellation is quite good for earbuds. The Sony wireless headphones I have are better but they’re full sized headphones. What Apple achieved with such a small device is really cool. The transparency mode is also really nice, if I need to strike up a conversation with someone or be aware of sound cues in my environment, I can easily do that.It’s an expensive purchase but if you’re someone who values something that is convenient and “just works”, this is a good option.As for the negatives, there is something off with the quality control regarding the shape? The first pair I got caused a lot of pain in my left ear, the second pair in the right ear. It was my third pair that ended up being perfect. Docking a point because for a premium product, which I consider this to be, that should be something that is dialed in during quality control.
Not only a great for top-end sound it helps us seniors hear better. Not an OTC hearing aid Yet!
Very good earbuds!
Excellent produit!
I’m happy with it.
Awesome but too expensive even on Black Friday ,’:(
Mieux que ce qu’on espérait
I guess you get what you pay for, wonderful sound quality, fit in ear better than the ones without the silicone tips. Bought these on sale, otherwise would have chosen another brand.
Not much improvement compared with older models,Noise Cancelling almost same as 1st generation.  Little bit disappointed.

reviewTitle: People on work calls keep asking me what my headset is - because it sounds so good
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviewDescription: I finally stopped resisting and got myself a set of airpods, and really wish I had done so sooner. These are every bit of the quality and high standard that's expected with Apple products (and the premium price to go with it).I needed some kind of hands free earbuds or bluetooth device for Teams and phone calls, and tried all kinds of things, spent over $200 with Jabra and got something that had a complicated app, poor running time, and ultimately was terrible for calls, picking up a lot of noise especially wind noise when outside. Then I bought 2 different Bluetooth headsets from Plantronics and couldn't find anything approaching an actual good level of quality, even after spending upwards of $100.Syncing the Airpods to my iPad tablet, Windows computer, and Samsung smartphone worked great and was easy. It also seems to do well at "sensing" what device I'm trying to use, if I put the earbuds in while joining a teams call or phone call it usually is already connected without needing to do a lot of switching in the device. Finally, active noise cancelling is a huge benefit. I fly a lot and don't know what I'd do without noise cancelling on a plane.Finally, the downsides: First, the Find Me software is useless. These are supposed to have Airtags built in, for both the case and the airpods themselves, but it doesn't seem to work, and it's a well known problem, with several pages of threads on Apple's support forums. I've tried resetting absolutely everything and my iPad won't see the airpods on the list, even if it's connected to them via bluetooth and they're right next to it. So beware of that, if you're expecting their AirTag service to find these when you lose them - it won't. Fortunately you can buy replacement parts, aftermarket cases are as low as $35, and Apple sells individual buds for about $80 each.Second and it goes along with the first problem, but the case lid is "flappy" for a lack of a better word. It doesn't really latch, which means if you drop the case, the lid is apt to flap open and the airpods will tumble out with it. Which that going along with the problem of the Find Me software not working right becomes a real issue. With Find Me failing you can't even "beep" them like you're supposed to be able to do, when I lost them once (cats ended up knocking them off the table then carrying them around the house like toys) I ended up just forcing them to be on in the bluetooth settings (even if not in your ear) and then just playing loud beeps through a youtube video. A far less elegant workaround to a feature that should just work.

The sound quality is fantastic, and the build quality is second to none. The usability is fantastic, as it connects to your phone in seconds, and it's never a hassle waiting for the devices to pair. Of course, it's quite expensive, especially compared to other wireless earbuds on the market, but it's apple, so that's expected. The design is beautiful, and they're comfortable to wear, provided you select the correct tip size (included).

I was hesitating at first to purchase as it is bit expensive. But definitely it was worth the money. Noise cancellation, sound quality everything is just perfect. Buds fit perfectly in ears. Quality is premium and it lasts for 2-3 days in one charge. Overall it’s kind of perfect in a sense.

reviewTitle: New iPhone used and seriously impressed
reviewDescription: I was a Samsung android user for about 15 years and finally decided to make the switch to iPhone with the new 15 Pro lineup, as I love my  M1 MBP and I have been following Apple  products from afar since. Now that the 15 lineup is USB C, I decided to go all in on the Apple ecosystem.I am blown away by these airpods. Thankfully the second gens come with XS ear tips, because that's the only size that doesn't slowly push themselves out of my ear.But let me get to what I really love about these things:- the seamless transfer of connection between my M1 macbook pro and iPhone. It happens in about 1.5 seconds flat as soon as I begin playing audio/video on another device. And somehow it also knows when I don't need it to transfer?! I don't even know.-the charging speed of the pods themseld. I think I just popped them into the case for 10 mins, less than 15 for sure, and they jumped from 18% charge to 80% just like that.-transparency and noise cancellation. Remarkable and I use both depending on my environment. Haven't really found a use for Adaptive mode after a while, but that's ok. When you're walking on a busy street, noise cancellation is so soothing. Drowns out like 90-95% of the traffic sounds.-conversational awareness is great too, but I generally leave it off unless I'm in a grocery store or somewhere that I might need to interrupt the audio by speaking to someone for a few seconds. Only time I use it.- Con: they're super slippery! I have dropped the pods a couple of times because of this, especially when you get any skin oils on them, but no damage so far. I also just got a silicone cover for the charging case, in hopes that the pods don't just eject themselves when you drop the whole case on the floor. I think that fixed my concern in some quick tests from a 2 foot drop on carpet, because I've seen them eject from that height before.BONUS: These airpod pro 2s with USB C have a special feature that lightning cable pro 2s do not! Lossless audio, but this only applies to using them with the Vision Pro. I probably won't but the Vision Pro any time soon, but it's good to know that I will have that feature should I ever get them in the future.Buy these at full price or especially buy them when you see them 10-17% off. You will NOT be disappointed.

Having upgraded from the regular airpods gen 2 I can say with confidence this is one of the best purchases of the year. The price was a little steep but look to buy during holiday sales (black friday - boxing day).Noise cancellation is phenomenal, ability to control volume from the head phones itself is extremely useful, and the product is built well. I've used knock off airpods before and it is night and day the difference in quality.While the price is a little high, the noise cancellation, sound quality, and overall functionality do justify spending a bit more for genuine airpods pro 2.

reviewTitle: 100% Would recommend. Long time hesitant on buying never going back
reviewDescription: For a long time I was hesitant about buying air pods as I thought they were over priced. I have only used iPhones but thought the air pods were ridiculous. Now I have them there is no comparison. They have better noise cancelling than my Sony WH1000XM3. They work seamlessly with iPhones. I always thought what's the big deal to have to turn it on and wait for a few seconds for bluetooth to connect, wow after the air pods I can never go back. Out the case, slap it on, music plays instantly. To be 100% honest, on sale at 290 CAD it is a bargin when I compare them to my Sony headphones. I can't believe I'm saying an apple product is a bargin but they just WORK and they work VERY VERY WELL.
You can never go wrong with this product! Good quality and good look.

Issues: Find my was not working, was getting some issues on icloud, the airpod symbol was headphones instead, the battery and charging case icons was just black so I couldn't see what percentages it was. Went to apple store and took like an hour to troubleshoot (they did say it was authentic apple product so that's good)Solution: Turns out it was cuz software wasn't up to date as these came out after iOS16. Went home, cleared out 10gb worth of storage updated it and all works fine now :) if you're having similar issues, try updating!Pros: Really love the noise cancelling put i personally like silence instead of music so if its just noise cancelling without other sound on top its decent but i still get distracted. If you have sound on top, and people talk to you, you can barely hear them. Transparency is amazing, I take earbud off and notice no difference compared to having it on - it's almost eerily.Charges supppppper fast its shockingCons: I wish there was a setting to have it turned off when removed from ear for long period of time. I sleep with them on, take it off in the middle of the night and next morning they're dead.

Je les adore, les meilleurs écouteurs que j’ai eu, le embout XS sont parfait pour mes oreilles et le noise cancellation fonctionne super bien, j’adore toutes les possibilités incluent dans les écouteursJe vous recommande peut être d’aller les essayer chez apple pour être certain que vous les trouvez confortable pour votre type d’oreilles, mais n’hésitez pas a les acheter sur amazon, car ils tombent parfois en rabaisÇa faisait des années que je les voulais et je les adore, n’hésitez pas! 10/10

Je les utilise tous les jours dans les transports en commun et c’est très efficace. Ça  me garde dans ma bulle sans toutefois me couper complètement du reste du monde. C’est très bien comme ça.Le son est très bon,j'ai aussi des boses qc35 , je les trouve aussi bien. Les boses sont plus introspectifs de part leur nature même, mais les AirPod se font oublier très rapidement, leurs légèretés les aident beaucoup. Et comme ce sont des Apple, ils sont très bien intégrés aux iPhone et iPad.Rien à redire.

I edit videos/photos with my phone and would annoy my partner constantly. She would need to listen to clips on repeat as I edit and when I put music into my clips. I would also not hear a thing she says the moment the earphones go in.IN COMES IN THE AIRPODS PRO.Now with transparency, i'm able to hear what she says before I get hit.She can also tune me out when she wants to with the noise cancellation feature! (She got her own cuz she got jealous of mine).Too bad it's expensive. Otherwise, they are extremely useful. The only problem is the quad $$$$ sign.Very worth it!

reviewTitle: Works after falling out of a 3rd floor window!
reviewDescription: I bought these after trying the Sony WF-1000XM4s, which were great but way too big for my ears. These fit much more comfortably and the sound is comparable to me. I like the simplicity of the controls. The noise cancelling doesn't seem as good as my partner's AirPods but I also haven't done the in-app optimization.Here's the best part: I leaned out of a 3rd-floor window with my head turned and the left earbud fell out, onto the pavement, into the snow! Only months later have I noticed any slight lagging or connection issues with that earbud, and the issues seem to resolve themselves quickly. I thought they would be done for; very impressed!

reviewTitle: Great battery life, comfortable, & connect reliably — also good for small ears
reviewDescription: I have small ears and have purchased a LOT of wireless earbuds. These are my favorite. They fit, have not broken down, connect easily and reliably, have good sound quality, and have reasonable water resistance. They hold a charge for a long time and charge quickly. They're easy to use, and I actually prefer the manual controls (as opposed the touch controls - I find I often accidentally touch those and end up inavertedly pausing/stopping my music/podcast). They're comfortable, too. No complaints. Great value for the price (even better than more expensive ones I've bought).PS - If you're contemplating buying $50 earbuds from a random amazon brand... don't. I've bought at least 6 pairs of those, and they all break down (one or both earbuds stop connecting, or they won't charge) within 6 months. I wish I would've spent a bit more at the outset and bought a reliable pair of earbuds. Besides these earbuds, I also like anker sport and ear fun (they're both poorer quality than these, but lasted longer than the other cheap-ish earbuds). Bose earbuds are good high end ones (I bought the quiet comfort ones), but they are too big for my ears and don't connect reliably (but the sound and battery life is great).
They are very good and comfortable to use and last the bacteria in use.

I really enjoy reading at coffee, shops, and outside at sidewalk cafés or doing work on my laptop. Often these places are very noisy so the noise cancelling feature on these headphones combined with some quiet background music makes it very easy to concentrate.These earbuds fit beautifully in my ears and with their low profile design, hardly stick out of the ear at all. I really like the preprogrammed, touch controls and the option to program my own commands.I would only rate the sound on these as fairly good compared to others. I’ve tried, but it’s good enough for me.I would recommend buying these, especially at the sale price I got

It has good Noise cancellation and you can choose to hear outside sound or block them out (not completely).  But it's good to use it while near some loud noise area while enjoy your music.  The price is good and love the colour as well.  For the battery, it's not bad maybe it'll last longer than 6 hours and you can just put them back into the case and re-charge again.

reviewTitle: 40 - 60ms delay on BT 5.2/3 using LE Audio - Sufficient for gaming
reviewDescription: They say these in-ears have too much of a delay for gaming, which is true if you use < BT 5.0, as on BT 4.2 I had a 190ms delay. I upgraded to a BT 5.3 PCIe receiver and now get 40 - 60ms, which is a totally-acceptable delay imo and I've been able to play competitive games with it.Again, IF you have BT 5.2+ in your PC, you'll be able to play at an acceptable latency/delay for competitive gaming, if wireless is an absolute necessity for you.Otherwise, if you're okay with wired in-ears, check out the razer hammerhead pro's.
Bought these as a gift for my son and he loves them .

I have nothing to dislike about this, except for the battery life being a little bit less then others. Otherwise it doesn’t factor to me because I always have power nearby. Regarding sound the base is pretty good, but I think it could be improved. Most importantly, the best part of this product is the quality. No one is now complaining over the way my voice sounds

I only had this earphones for about a week as I lost them when I travelled.😭😭😭😭However, for the week and a half I had them I really enjoyed the earbuds.The sound was amazingThe fit was on pointThe noise canceling function amazing. Turn it on on the plane ride and it blocked 90% of the ambient sound. Awesome
The sound is amazing well worth it

reviewTitle: Even on sale they weren't worth it for me
reviewDescription: I'll keep this fairly brief because I also only used them for less than an hour but it was enough for me to send them back.Sound:- I was unsatisfied with the sound. I lacked clarity and just sounded mushy overall. Yes an EQ curve fixed this but I have lots of different headphones and having to switch my EQ every time I use these would be rather annoying. They're heavy in bass. Some people might like this, I am not one of these people.Fit:Regardless of how I twisted and turned them, due to the lack of any other support, the only thing that holds them in are the in ear pieces themselves. My satellite dish sized ears offered too much real estate for these to end up sitting securely. So much as twisting my head to fast made them move and they always felt like they were about to fall out.App/software:boy is it ever overloaded with software and features but lacking where you really need it. You would have to sign up for all sorts of stuff before you can fully use them.There's no way to customize the touch functionality other than changing the preset function packages.You want volume control? you only get volume control and nothing else.you want music control? alright you can have it on the other ear but that's it.you want ANC control? Well you have to unassign one of the two prior to make space for these functionsNow you have a few functions like double and triple tap which are non functional? you want to modify these? too bad.A real bummer. No modification of single functions so regardless of what you choose, when listening to music with background noise changing and interacting with people every now and then you WILL have to interact with your phone. There's no way around it.I tried the auto transparency mode. Not for me. I want either on or off fully. Also it didn't sound realistic enough.Battery:Biggest disappointment.in the 30 minutes max I used them I could watch the battery drain and go down. And that wasn't even listening to music the whole time but setting up the app and adjusting settings. I started at 60% and by the time I was done they were already down to 40%. Those will not get you through your workday or even through a half day until break.I can absolutely not recommend these, not even on sale.And when I purchased them they were 44% off.I'll stick with my samsung galaxy buds plus. They sound better, last longer and give me the option to customize my touch controls how ever I need them.

reviewTitle: Sound is good, but highly unreliable
reviewDescription: Using these earbuds gives me anxiety.They are highly sensitive to touch. Blinking sounds all the time for no reason.I was doing a 10k race and my hair got wet, earbuds were making sound every 10 seconds switching from ambient to noise canceling mode, because wet hair touched the earbud.  Sometimes I am at home listening to some lecture and earbuds make sound of switching on and off or something. I turned off all other devices and it’s still happening. Every time I leave my apartment it makes a sound, etc. I turned off all “smart settings” in the app and installed the latest software for these, but this stuff keeps happening. At this point these are the worst earbuds by usability. Also, drop down menu is very limited for each earbud, they are pre-programmed. Cannot properly set up controls.Recharge is much slower than many other earbuds I had before and they are exhausted faster than other (my guess - because of all the smart features, useless to me personally).The only good thing is that the sound is good when I’m on call outside and they don’t grab all that street noise that much. But for 300cad earbuds they could be much much better. I am very disappointed with these earbuds. Too unreliable and too unpredictable. Cannot fix any of these terrible bugs.

Experience amplified outside noise in a call to the caller, which leads to discomfort call and cant hear the voice from call recipient properly.Though it is in noice cancelation mode it automatically switches to ambient mode and disturbs in calls. I noticed this bug while am playing a video status in whatsapp and in all type of calls.

reviewTitle: They're great when they work, but the right earbud is very buggy.
reviewDescription: - Right earbud unpredictably disconnects, multiple times a day.- Multipoint connection is spotty (and sometimes sounds tinny).- Right earbud has suddenly started to produce an unfixable "wind" sound when Noise Cancelling or Ambient Noise is turned on.If you look these issues up on the Reddit forums, you'll find that many people are having these same issues. So they return the earbuds for replacements, they work as intended for a bit, but then the issues come right back up.I'd love to keep these earbuds. They're comfortable, sound good, and are great for outdoor phone calls. I've even figured out a workaround the disconnection problem by either removing the right earbud and giving it a shake, or by tapping on it a bunch until it reconnects. But the final straw was the wind noise. Imagine a hissing feedback but it's literally the sound of wind, coming from the right earbud, indoors. It's strange and there's no fixing it. I've factory reset the earbuds. Repaired them from all my devices. Stopped using them for a little while and coming back to them. Still there.After owning the Linkbuds S for a month and a half, I'm returning them. They have way too many issues for such new earbuds. I'm going to wait until I've read that all of these issues have been resolved. In the meantime, I think I'm gonna go find a used pair of Jabra Elite 75ts.

I had expectations for these, the sound quality is amazing, sooo comfortable to wear but  the music can only be paused/stopped by the right side.I cannot work with both earbuds only one at the time. So that will be a return for me, I'm so disappointed, even cheap earbuds have that function, "WTH"  Sony!!

Do the headphones work? Sometimes. Are they very loud? not really. Can you wear one instead of 2 at the same time? Only if it's the right ear. Once the right ear dies you can't use the left one by itself (how weird is that?). The battery life is much worse than my old Samsung buds, so if you're used to that, you won't like these. The noise cancelling is good and the size is good,  but overall I am not happy with the purchase. I checked the return date and I just missed it, as it has been a busy time. I will probably sell these privately and look for something else based on this experience.

reviewTitle: If you like your ears, please rethink EarBuds
reviewDescription: This review is mostly regarding your ear health.The product is good. The sound quality, noise cancellation, battery life. Sony does a great job with these.You wouldn't expect such good ANC from such a small device. But it does very good.But if you care about your ears in the long run, please take a second and rethink purchasing earbuds. Any kind for that matter. Any kind of earbuds needs to be pushed into the ear canals to provide you with noise cancellation and also being placed "comfortably." However, that pushing of the buds to the ears can be extremely painful for over 10minutes of use. Imagine using them for an hour, multiple times a day, for some years.... That is definitely going to do something to those ear canals.If you want something comfortable that's way less hurtful, go for over-ear headphones. Those are way healthier for your ears in the long-run. But of course be careful of increased volumes as even that in the best headphones can hurt your ears.Hope you got something from this.

reviewTitle: Similar sound quality to cheaper options from sony
reviewDescription: The Bluetooth connection wasn't stable for me even i did try reconnecting a few time. No difference in sound quality from cheaper options from sony. Only advantage is automatic pause and play when you put them off/on

reviewTitle: very good noise cancellation and sound quality however terrible mic and phone calls
reviewDescription: I bought this headphones for 2 reasons; to use at the gym and phone calls in my breaks at work.at the gym the headphones isolates you to an extent with decent sound quality which fulfills the the first reason. HOWEVER it's a terrible headphones for phone calls the person on the other end always has troubles hearing me and says my voice sounds muffled so you have to speak louder and shout. Unfortunately I said I would give it a try and forget about the return date which passed. All in all good material , sound quality ,noise cancellation but terrible mic for phone calls (used on an iphone 11)

reviewTitle: Sound is great, but bluetooth connexion is the worse i've seen
reviewDescription: These earbuds are not bad, but whenever you take a walk, the bluetooth connexion keeps disconnecting. Not worth the 300 $, not at all. 100 $ have way better connexion

Honest (and long) review:TLDR: These earbuds are good. They have solid value for money, ANC, Sound and Comfort. The design is awesome, I really like the stemless sleek design. The app/features are excellent. Unfortunately the battery life is pretty mid and the build quality feels cheap, especially the case.If you want a more in depth review. Read below.Sound 3.5/5Noise cancelling 4/5Build quality 3/5Battery 3.5/5Features & App support 5/5Comfort 4/5Aesthetics 4.5/5Overall 4/5SoundThe sound is good. I have no problems with it but I’m also by no means an audiophile or even an enthusiast. To the average ear, these are good and you’ll most likely have no complaints, but you also won’t be blown away. 3.5/5ANCThe noise cancelling is really good. It’s better than my Onemore sono flow overear headphones but I’ve never used the xm5’s and quiet comforts of the world so I can’t really compare them. If thats really your budget you probably don’t need to be reading this review. The passthrough mode is also good, they have some features that turn it on and off depending on what you’re doing which I’ll get to later. 4/5Build QualityI haven’t had any technical issues outside of some very infrequent cutting while walking. This is pretty much unavoidable with bluetooth earbuds though and will happen even with the XM5s.My biggest problem with these is the build quality. The ear buds themselves are fine. They’re mat black which is cool but its like a rough sandpapery texture that feels a bit odd. They’re super light, (which I guess they were going for) and the silicone tips are standard. The real problem though is the case. It’s so light it feels hollow, like if I press hard enough I could break it just with my thumb (probably not but thats what it feels like). It doesn’t feel like a premium product or even as nice as the original airpods I upgraded from. Granted, they’re supposed to be that middle tier, not premium but not entry level. Unfortunately in terms of build and feel, they are more akin to the latter.BatteryThe battery is fine, they’re not nearly as long as the airpods so that sucks. If you’re doing long study/work sessions like 5+ hours without putting them back in the case, they’ll get close to dying.The case battery is decent but you’ll have to charge it every 2-4 days assuming heavy - average use. Airpods I used to charge once a week, sometimes less. 3.5/5Features and APP supportOkay again, I’m not an audiophile so if you’re looking for a good understanding of the different EQ options you’re out of luck. From what reddit says, they’re decent. BUT from an average person’s perspective, the other features are fantastic. The app is great, lots of features lots of settings but not in an overwhelming way. You can use alexa on them which is cool although she’s can be a bit buggy sometimes. They also have a chat to mute function which automatically stops music and turns on passthrough mode when you start talking and reverses that after a few seconds when you stop. It might not be for everyone, it takes a few seconds to work sometimes but I like it. They also have different tapping functions, if you tap on the left ear it switches between ANC, Passthrough and standard, you can also remove one of these and just have it switch between two (I removed standard). Right ear pauses/plays (one tap) or goes to the next song (two) or goes back to the previous (three). Overall the features are very cool and seems to be where they put their money. 5/5ComfortI find these pretty comfortable even after 5-6 hours of having them in. Not much else to say really. If you’re worried about that weird ringing feeling that some noise cancelling has, I didn’t get that with these. The silicone tips are ordinary but they come in 4 different sizes which is nice. I’ve never tried foam tips, if thats your thing you can probably buy third party tips. 4/5AestheticsTo be honest, a major factor in buying these over the airpods was that they’re black and stemless. The white ones some people think look like cotton balls although they’re not as bad as Galaxy buds and other thicker ones. The black ones though are suuuuper sleek and you can barely see them when you’re looking straight in the mirror. They barely protrude from the ear. This also makes it really nice for laying on them if thats something you’re interested in. 4/5I took like 30 mins out if my day to write this so if you made it this far cool! But also, you’re probably getting review burn out and need to chill lol. Make a decision and live your life :)

reviewTitle: A Good Pair of Sony Earbuds... Albeit With Some Slight Caveats.
reviewDescription: Ever since I got these back in January, I had an excellent time using them. The noise cancelation was that on-par with my Sony WF-1000XM3, some convenience features that make using the LinkBuds S like Spotify Tap and Google Assistant integration, alongside with Fast Pair (on Android devices only) a breeze, and the build quality is as good as any other high-end product from Sony. Although there's no Qi wireless charging support, and the case maybe prone to scratch damage (hence I recommend a case for these sorts of things), it's fair given for what is given with the current price. However, I've taken into some consideration with using these earbuds, and alongside two of the main issues I had with my experience after a month of usage:1. The big issue being for me was with the Noise Cancelation/Ambient Sound. I've had my first pair producing a slight wind noise on my right earbud, and there was no way of getting rid of it. The only solution that I was given was to turn off ANC completely, which ruined the experience altogether. Plus, it even affected call quality and that I wasn't able to use Speak-to-Chat as a result. This happened three weeks after receiving them. I've since requested a replacement unit, and have now taken extra precautions in regards to this massive problem. Unless my first unit was defective, I really can't say for sure as there are a few incidents from other users having the exact same situation. It could be either a hardware or software flaw from what I know, but I wouldn't wanna risk it. I've haven't updated my second pair to the latest version as of now, and have turned off Ambient Sound Control and ANC until there's some resolution.2. Battery life is another problem that has also plagued my first pair. After setting it up right out of box, I noticed one earbud having drained from 100-0% faster than the other. This wasn't what I was expecting to have happen to me after setting everything up. A few days later, the issue was slowly going away, though I was still constantly seeing either the right or left bud chewing through battery life more and more. It was concerning to me, especially with the amount of cycles that a pair like these are supposed to last. The more the battery drains and charges, the more charge cycles you go through, and therefore the battery health goes down with it (similar to a phone or power bank). Much like the second pair, I've turned off ANC and Ambient Sound Control, which does dramatically improve the products lifespan while wearing them. Though, it's a bit frustrating to know that some of the best features on these earbuds are the main cause of quick battery drain.So while I have enjoyed using these Sony LinkBuds S wireless earbuds for a month now, it's hard to say for sure if I would recommend it to others. Unless the issues I have are resolved in a future hardware update, I would give these Sony buds a pass for now. It's really good for the price point, but not so much in terms of reliability or longevity.

I had to retire my Samsung Galaxy buds (old set). I was skeptical to change brands but the sound is so clear. The price is abit steep, but I got it on sale (still expensive).Need to explore the other options....so far it is great.Happy with my purchase 😀

reviewTitle: A lot more yellow than I expected
reviewDescription: I haven’t tried it yet but so far the texture of the case feels nice and not slippery like the AirPods. After changing the silicon in ear bud, it fits a lot better. Doesn’t slip. It is currently charging so I haven’t been able to connect it to my Sony app or test it out. When I do, I will update my post.

reviewTitle: Great sound, decent ANC, perfect fit
reviewDescription: I bought these to replace a set of Soundcore Liberty Pro 3 that sounded great for the price but they just wouldn't stay in my ears no matter which tips and wings I would choose. Also, I didn't find the noise cancelling effective enough for my needs ( I work in a pretty noisy environment). So I figured I'd try the Sony Linkbuds S since a lot of reviews I read and watched said they were a better fit for smaller ears. They do feel like they go deeper in your ear canal and sit better in the ear. They are also very light, so they aren't fatiguing to wear for long periods of time.The sound of the Linkbuds S is a little on the dark side straight out of the box, but I prefer a more laid back and warmer sound. It's easy to get more details in the highs and mids within the app's EQ on my cellphone. The bass is not very strong, but it stays punchy and detailed without getting muddy.The active noise cancelling is very good once you found the right tips, although it's not as good as what I get out of my pair of Sony WH-1000XM2 headphones. Still, it does a decent job. The only negative point is that there is a lot of hiss (noise) in the Ambient Sound mode. The sound does feel electronically processed. But I don't use these earbuds in Ambient Sound mode so it's not so much of a concern to me. EDIT: After having had these for a few months now, I find that with the right tips, the passive noise cancelling works better than the active noise cancelling. This is even better since the passive noise cancelling doesn't drain the battery as much as the ANC.Also, being that these are pretty small earbuds, the battery life is not great. But I can easily charge them in the case while I eat lunch and I'll be good for my 8 hours shift.In clonclusion, at $299 they are a little pricey but I think they are still a great value. If you can grab them at around $250 if they come down in price, they would be an absolute great value.

reviewTitle: Popular choice with good features if you buy on sale
reviewDescription: Sound: good "clear bass" sound, good equalizer, but not 5* experience for audiophiles. My Technics EAHAZ60PS sound better (without the bass), and at $199)Fit: very good, with excellent natural sound insulation adding to noise cancellation. Earbuds are very light, but may fall off, so not very good for jumping people. Cannot sleep with them on side.Noise cancellation: good, but not the 5* experience. If you look out there there are better choices.Multi-point Bluetooth connection: yes, added via app software upgrade. Works well for answering a call, and moving back to your initial source after call has ended.App features: be aware that "Speak to Chat" , "Pause When Headphones Are Taken Off" do not work on a second connected device. They only worked for me on the mobile where I have installed the app (same happened with my second SONY headphones Sony WH-1000XM4, overhead ones). This was disappointing coming from Sony.Battery Life: not so good. You can see the batteries life go down as you listen a few songs. My Technics EAHAZ60PSbatteries last way, way longer. Disappointment from Sony.Case: plasticky, fits in your palm, looks sturdier than Technics EAHAZ60PS case. Has a e state battery level LED and USB-C charging capability, have not tried yes wirelessly.Value: Bought them on sale at $160ish. Would not advise pay full price as Technics EAHAZ60PS are better sounding at $199, and better battery life.Made in China for geo-location fans.Weird fact: Sony groups its touch features in groups. The defaults are: Right bud, pause, play, forward, back etc, Left bud: ambient/noise cancellation/off. You cannot have volume up/down from the Left bud (you can with Technics EAHAZ60PS ). Sony has an attention touch function that Technics EAHAZ60PS  does not have.

reviewTitle: If they're on sale for less than $200 CAD, buy them.
reviewDescription: I bought these as an upgrade from some random monster wireless earbuds I had on a black friday sale, I paid $168 for them. At that price they are truly a steal, however if paying retail, I do not think they are worth it.The noise cancelling is exceptional, what you would expect from a pair of Sony earbuds. However I did try my friends pixel buds pro and I noticed that the noise cancelling on those was slightly better at blocking out voices. That being said the noise cancelling on these is still incredible.The sound quality is where these suffer, they have significantly smaller drivers than the xm4s and pixel buds pro. Out of the box they did not have enough base for me, but after toying with the equalizer I have gotten a sound that I do like.The battery life is also not that great, I find myself charging the case about every 3 days but I am a somewhat heavy user, and charging every 3 days isn't that had.One other thing to note, for my ears these buds fit exceptionally well, never falling out or getting lose. If you have smaller ears, definitely go for these, they are much more comfortable for me than the xm4s or pixel buds pro.I would whole heartedly recommend them to someone looking for a pair of small earbuds with good sound quality and exceptional noise cancelling. I also got the 'sand' colour which I quite like, earwax doesnt show up on them as much and for people with darker complexions it looks rather nice.

I like the sound from them. I use them with Comply foam tips and it's extremely comfortable. The noise cancelling is decent, but I switch to headphones with noise cancelling when it's really noisy. It's easy to pair with multiple device.I had to fiddle around with my tablet to get LDAC for better audio, but I suspect the Bluetooth doesn't remain stable as I'll hear random artifacts from time to time, that's an issue that I don't have with my Sony wireless headphones.If you're thinking of sleeping with these, it doesn't work as a side sleeper, but you can use a single one at a time in the ear that's not resting on your pillow.Ocassionally, one bud won't pair to the proper device and I'll have to put them back in their container, count to 10, and try again then it works. (One bud pairs to tablet while the other pairs to my phone or nothing)

reviewTitle: Smart Earbuds: Impressive Sound, Poor Battery
reviewDescription: After using the product for almost two months, I have mixed feelings about the sony linkbuds s. On the positive side, the sound quality is impressive, with great instrument separation that really enhances the listening experience. Additionally, the noise cancelling feature works very well, blocking out distractions and immersing you in your music.However, there are some downsides to the product as well. I have had some issues with multipoint connectivity, which can be frustrating. And while the earbuds are supposed to have up to six hours of battery life, I have found that they only last around three hours with continuous play time. This can be a real inconvenience when you're on the go and don't have access to a charger.Overall, I would recommend the Smart earbuds if you're looking for a high-quality listening experience with excellent noise cancelling. Just be aware that you may run into some connectivity and battery issues along the way.

reviewTitle: Best so far for small ears! Sony app does what you need but UI is bad
reviewDescription: I've got what must be abnormally small ear concha and canals and these are the only solid pair of earbuds that fit me and have the features I want. I've tried Soundcore Life P3, Airpods Pro, Beats Fit Pro and the LinkBuds S are the best so far in terms of small ears fit, solid noise cancelling, and solid sound quality. Surely a master of none compared to Airpods Pro (transparency mode king), Sony WF-1000XM4 (noise cancelling king) and sound quality depends who you ask...Side note: Soundcore Life P3 actually fit quite well but the noise cancelling is not quite as good and they are also a bit bulkier horizontally due to the stem design. They also crapped out on me within a month and one bud decided to never make sound again....Again though, for someone with small ears, all these higher quality buds mean nothing if the fit sucks and the seal in your canal is not good. Really lucked out that these came out just at the tail end my earbuds hunt.The App does everything you need but man does the UI overcomplicate things. Sony could really take a hint from Apple or even Soundcore for getting a better structured/simplified app. Thankfully the buds offer pretty robust options for touch controls.All in all, these probably won't blow you away compared to other buds but they do everything very solidly for those of us with tiny ears.

reviewTitle: Not worth the price, only lasted 7 months
reviewDescription: Left the case out in the rain when I went camping. The earbuds worked fine, it wasn’t until I tried to charge them again that the case light wasn’t working and the earbuds stopped charging. Reached out to sony customer support via phone and chat….awful, the chat kept disconnecting and the phone request was disconnected mid conversation. Reach out through text (best way to get support fast) Eventually they said that it wasn’t covered under warranty (accidental damage), turned an set of earbuds into an expensive paperweight. I’ve had 50$ earbuds thrown into the washing machine more times then I can count  last longer than this set. Sucks they don’t water proof their case from rain.

Sony had a reputation for quality and I really wanted to love these things. Unfortunately though, after only a couple days of use I ran into a whole bunch of problems. Problems which, after some googling, are apparently quite common.- The charging case arrived at my door with a 2% charge, which is terrible for lithium batteries.- both earbuds discharge at drastically different speeds.- There is a constant, annoying background noise when ANC is enabled.- The right earbud will randomly disconnect during media playback.- The right earbud disconnects as soon as i answer a phone call.- The case feels so laughably cheap and weak; There is no way thing thing would last me a year.These types of problems are completely unacceptable with such a hefty price tag and this experience has left me quite disappointed in Sony as a brand. Instead of getting a replacement, i've opted to simply return them and try something else. Sad.

reviewTitle: Blowing sound after 2 months with 3 separate units.
reviewDescription: TL;DR: I would not recommend the Sony LinkBuds S as they are prone to breaking and are made with cheap materials. If you have small ear canals, I would advise against purchasing them as they may not fit properly and could break.The Sony LinkBuds S are a waste of money. The materials used in their construction feels cheap, and the design is so poor it breaks during very light use. If your ear canal is too small, the buds can break due to compressive forces on the weak plastic sound nozzle, resulting in a permanent and constant blowing sound out of one or both of the buds when active noise cancelling (ANC) is on. Additionally, pushing on the metal grill on the outside of the buds when inserting them into your ears can cause them to break, resulting in a squealing sound when the active noise cancellation (ANC) is on (I think they damaged my hearing they squealed so loud).How these simple issues were not discovered during the design process or quality control of this product is  beyond me. These ear buds should be recalled as they are a danger to people's hearing due to the sudden and VERY loud squealing when they break, which, as stated, are very easy to break accidently. Normal use should not break a product after only 2 months, or, for my 3rd set, in 2 days. If Sony fixed these issues and made the product more "durable" (Though making a product that withstands normal use after 2 months shouldn't be considered "durable." It should just be standard) then these ear buds would be fantastic, but until then, steer clear.

reviewTitle: Bought them. Tried them. Waved by at them
reviewDescription: They were on sale 40% off.Sounded like a good deal.The case is a bit rugged but i know it can smoother with time.Earbuds are well made and you can almost forget that you wear them.Sound quality is not great. I don't get the people saying that it is. Yes you have a bass but.. what about the rest? Every seems unbalanced and the app is not helpful.Goodbye

So I have been using the Jaybird vista 2s for 6 months and previous to that have always had jaybird products such as the x4 and jaybird Tarah pros. However, I find that the jaybird vista 2s can be finicky when it comes to transferring connection from my MacBook to my iPhone or vice versa so I figured I would get the link buds s as they had good reviews said the fit was great and the sound quality was quite comparable to the Sony wf-xm4s and the soul reason was because they have multipoint connection feature. When I listened to the Sony link buds s for 10 minutes it was night and day how much of a downgrade the sound quality was on these headphones compared to my jaybird vistas or Tarah pros or any jaybird product. the sound on these have zero bass, no umpth in sound presence what so ever, it sounds flat as a pancake and the vocals and instrumental all sound not good. I do not understand how anyone recommends these headphones as you don't have to be an audiophile to tell these headphones greatly miss the mark. too bad tho because the fit is quite nice and I do like the feel and look of them but I could never get over the sound quality, definitely being returned.

reviewTitle: Second pair failed after a week
reviewDescription: So ok, its my fault cause i got the charging case wet, but now it wont charge the buds so they are all garbage.  I looked into replacing the case, but from what i can see it would cost as much as i spent on the entire product and require pairing them at an authorized service center.This was my second set.  The first set suffered from ear damaging feedback through the mics so they were replaced free of charge.Really sad neither set have been usable because they were comfortable and sounded good and had ok controls

I purchased these Sony Link Buds S mostly based on the positive reviews you see here on Amazon (I also read a third party review written by an audio reviewer who rated them highly). For me personally, this product was a failure. Firstly, they just didn't fit properly in my ears and were uncomfortable (this was after I made sure to use the correct tips and made many attempts at the placement of the buds in my ears). They were fatiguing and irritating after about 15 minutes (I do have small ears, maybe that's the problem). Secondly, I would rate the sound quality on these as poor (I don't know what all the fuss is about regarding the sound quality of this product, they just don't sound good). The sound lacks any bass foundation (even after eq-ing) and is thin and tinny sounding. Playing around with the equalizer settings never produced anything that I would call acceptable sound quality. Certainly not what a $300 CAD product should be. I'll be returning them and trying another product. If you're looking at these primarily for music listening, I would look elsewhere.

So many issues a few hours into using them.1. Software update wouldn't complete, would keep aborting, I had to uninstall the app and reinstall it.2. The left earbud wouldn't work on its own (Sony says it should).3. the right earbud would lose charge so quick it was unusable. It went to 10% while the left one was still at 47%. Both were 100% when I took them out of the case.4. The app would give me an activity notification that wouldn't go away, and couldn't be dismissed.Sony just doesn't know how to make audio gear. Apart from noise cancelling, the entire experience is terrible. Their xm4s and wh1000 series have way too much bass which is muddy and messes up the vocals. Much smaller companies like soundcore are doing a far better job. These are another poorly built, poorly tuned, and overpriced set made by a failing audio manufacturer.Highly unrecommended. Unless you can get them for like 50 dollars. Returning.
Don't buy these the noise canceling doesn't work I bought 2 ...still the same problem

The earbuds themselves are good, sound is comparable to the Wireless XM4, but the dropouts... they're terrible. Sometimes all it takes is me turning my head to the side and it disconnects.I'm also now getting an issue where the volume on the right earbud is slightly lower then the left making everything sound weird. I have to put it in the case and put it back on after that for it to return to normal. It's been a very unpleasant experience so far unfortunately

reviewTitle: Not bad for entry level ear buds.
reviewDescription: These are very good for entry-level for the money. The ambient sound is good I’m not too sure if you’re somebody that likes bass but they’re not as good as Bose I feel. I bought these to wear in the water in case these get wet doing my cold water plunge. But if you have something covering them like a beanie over them. It blocks the sound and cuts out every min. It shuts them down. As far as distance from my iPhone I think I can get 30yards with them cut out again. So that’s ok. They have features that take getting used to. Like the turn sound down. You have the hood your finger down on the ear bud and it’s a certain way or it will start turning it up. Kinda frustrating at times. I would give them a solid 6-7 out of 10. I’m not experienced ear buds guy so what do I know.

Product says 6h, I only have 4h maximum (I use them at work and can barely do 8 to 12).Left side often disconnects and battery drains quicker on left side.Having to have two extra apps running plus say Spotify drains my cell battery like crazy. If I don't open at least the app "Headphones", sometimes they won't connect or I won't be able to use the buttons on them.Some features just don't work at all.Wish we could set the taps controls independently (like on/off noise canceling + having volume control instead of the non fonctionning Spotify feature and other apps I don't have and don't want).So yeah, disappointed about it, but overall still good.Didn't and wouldn't pay full price for this product.

reviewTitle: Transparency mode was disappointingly unnatural, digital, and harsh sounding.
reviewDescription: I got these on a prime day deal for $229. I returned them after a day of use. They just didn't meet my expectations for the price. The transparency mode was really digital sounding and harsh. That was very disappointing to me because I had the sony wh-1000xm3 and their transparency mode was quite good. I tend to use the transparancy feature a lot. The music and video sound quality is pretty good as expected from Sony but they also tend to sound really quite stuffy and confined. I wasn't able to get the perfect comfortable fit with any of the included eartips. I'm honestly starting to feel like maybe the design with the stem is actually the better design for fit and comfort - I'm not sure, but I always find myself preferring the fit of my wired buds. The ANC is good but not as good as my old wh-1000xm3s. I preferred the form factor of these Linkbuds S over the bulky wh-1000xm3 (which always fell out) but these honestly felt too small for my ears and with the comparitvely worse sound quality I felt these buds were fatiguing to wear and listen to. They have almost all the features I want and they have a nice form factor but they just didn't do the trick for me. Still looking for the goldilocks true wireless earbuds, I have a feeling it's the airpods pro gen 2, but they're just so dang expensive and I'm an android user so it would kill me to spend $ on those. Probably going to keep procrastinating and keep a buying phones with a headphone jack and get my high quality, lightweight feel, no latency audio experience with 30-40 dollar wired buds.

When i first got this product i was super excited. With multipoint connection this is a must for working in the office and being productive.I have had some issues with the application you need in order to best use the product. The application is in many ways to complicated for what is being delivered there are also nuances with Spotify that are annoying.Biggest pet peeve is the battery life. it says 6 hours but mine have not been lasting more than 3 hours which is deeply annoying and unimpressive.Its not a bad product all around, comfortable in the ears and noise cancelling for phone calls works REALLY well, just wish the batter worked better and there was a set up for zoom which provides really bad audio support.

Great quality, great noise cancelling. Unfortunately they lasted just over a year, while the warranty is conveniently only 1 year limited.Right side just totally failed and has never re connected.Worked with Sony help online but it was just "Unfortunate" how the warranty would no longer cover it.Onto the next brand.

reviewTitle: Great sound and mic. A few complaints
reviewDescription: Great soundAmazing microphonesSnug fitMulti device pairingAmbient sound iffyNeeds right bud to functionCould be louderTouch controls mediocre

They sound great but constantly fall out of my ears even with largest size. The touch functions are not very intuitive and maybe work half the time. Upside is the sound is great and the noise canceling is wonderful.

I bought the WF-1000XM4, they were great but too big for my small ears. These as the perfect size and have a very good sound quality but they are lacking in some departments. Firstly, the Bluetooth range is problematic. Where I usually had no problem with connection (even with  the WF-1000XM4) these tend to fail. Secondly, when I come back to the range of the second connected device, it does not reacquire the connection automatically. Most of the time, I have to reconnect manually and this is annoying. Thirdly, for me there is a desynchronization between the two earbuds and I can hear the slight delay between the two. Finally, this is not a major issue for me but it's finicky if you want to use just one earbud at a time.

I picked these up on sale for 168. For that price I find them decent. Though I cannot believe the price of earbuds in general. They just can't compete with over ear quality for similar prices. That said... I often wear headphones all day so it's nice to have this option.Pros:Sounds quality is good. Noise cancelling is good. Ambient sound flow through is fine. It sounds a bit like the cochlear implant in the movie Sound of Metal - which is what reminded me to write this review.Cons:I frequently have connection issues where the sound goes warbly or off in one side. Both with my phone and laptop. I find the app is trying to do too much and is more annoying than helpful.

I dont know if got a defective peice but the sound quality was not on as good as i expected from $223 earbuds i tried changing the EQ settings but it didn’t help me. There was also a connectivity issue. Usually the right one which was on playback settings didn’t produce any sound and there was also a scratching sound from time to time. The buds looked really cool and the finish felt premium. The noise cancelling was good enough and speak to chat function was something i really admired, looking at the problems i faced i had to return them.

reviewTitle: Great concept, terrible execution, constant connectivity issues
reviewDescription: I bought these with the intention of using them for cycling so I can hear the cars around me and my radar light alerts as cars approach. In theory they work great, you can listen to music while you ride and they sound decent enough. In practice, they are the most problematic headphones I've ever owned (currently have over 15 pairs from various brands). The bluetooth range is terrible and constantly drops out while riding. This is influenced by the position of the phone in my rear pockets on my jersey when I ride. If I don't put it directly in the middle, then the dropouts are far worse. Keep in mind this puts the phone only 2-3 feet max from the headphones.When you turn your head to shoulder check, the audio cuts out. Quite often when it comes back, the headphones will be out of sync, so you end up with very choppy, off beat audio. This happens every 3rd shoulder check I would say.I have gone through all the various troubleshooting steps, I have updated the firmware, and I have tested many different methods to stop this from happening.If you are sitting perfectly still with your phone near you, you likely won't experience this. If you are cycling along at 30km/h, they work very poorly and are very frustrating to use.Other observations -- Battery life is not amazing. An hour phone call will kill them. Other brands I get multiple hours of listening and talk before needing a charge.- The touch gestures work sporadically, and you can't configure them as flexibly as you can with other brands. You have to use their pre-selected function sets and can't mix and match commands.- The default connection type it wants to use is Spotify Connect if you have Spotify installed on your device. This is extremely unstable in my experience. Using Deezer is much more stable as it's forcing Bluetooth I believe. I can't remove the Spotify connect functionality no matter what I try.- The fit/stay in your ears is hit and miss. I find myself adjusting them often. I have at least 3 times lost one while riding, forcing me to double back and find it. I have the grey ones, and they are the EXACT color of some asphalt, making them impossible to find. If you have to buy these, get the white ones for contrast from pavement.I really wish I could return these honestly, they are a very flawed, very disappointing product from Sony who usually execute pretty well on concepts.

reviewTitle: Comfortable, no skin or ear irritation.......BUT there is a huge down side.
reviewDescription: Honestly these are great headphone however the fact that one ear bud (in this case the right) always does about twice as fast as the other. Now that normally wouldn't be a problem except I can't get then to work with out having both in my ears at the same time. So I have to put them back in the case and wait for them to charge.I have looked for about 3 months and tried 8 different open ear type ear buds. Most hurt my ears or caused really bad skin irritation and rashes.Finally these Sony link buds were the best but the fact that the battery life on the right bud is terrible is making me give them a low star review.I will be reaching put for product support and depending on what they say I may be back to change this review.I have also bought another pair because i honestly liked these so much but will end up sending them back if they have the same issues and sony has no solution.

reviewTitle: Earbuds are very particular about ear shape to get the most out of it
reviewDescription: So for having almost a year. I feel confident I can connect on this product about it's pros and cons.Pros: it's open ear design let's you hear the outside world. If you want to isolate the outside noise you wouldn't be looking at this product.Sound quality is nice if the environment is quiet enough.Cons: the earbuds must be placed in the rear in a correct way in order to get the most enjoyment out of them. Unfortunately my left ear is a different shape than my right and it kept moving, not staying in one place. It once fell out of my ear while bike riding. Also if it's not in the correct place the sound coming out of the buds will sound muffled and weak.After 8 months of almost daily use. The charging became buggy. Even if the 2 ear buds are securely in place, the left ear bud won't charge 80% of the time. It's annoying to see your right bud at 100% but the left one at 20% battery life. Battery degradation of the case seems fast. After 8 months I would have the charge the car daily vs every 4 days when it was new.In conclusion although it was a good concept. I wouldn't buy it again because of those 2 cons.

I was very excited to find these and give them a shot. I don't like noise canceling headphones so I figured these are right up my alley. Unfortunately they have been an overall letdown. To start the battery life is terrible, they have a hard time meeting their quoted hours. But they do and I knew the battery was not top tier. The sound quality has been a huge letdown, they can't get very loud at all. Not that you would want to listen to them at high volume as they get so compressed at high volume it sounds like your listening through a tin can. Below "halfish" volume they sounds decent for the price. Lastly if your moving at all they cut in and out often to the point it's about once every song. The only place they Excell is for calls and watching media in bed, especially if you need to be aware of your surounding. I still love the idea and concept and hope sony can improve them. I would lovr a pair of "open back" headphones.

I waited 5 days for it to be delivered then charge it overnight only to find out that the right bud isn't charging well then I saw that the charging dock has 3 pins but on the right has only 2. I still hasn't get my refund yet till this day. so this appointededit: just got my refund  waited almost 3 weeks

reviewTitle: Big miss on potentially huge product!
reviewDescription: The good, they sound amazing while they work and stay connected.The bad is pretty much everything else.- poor packaging, hard to cleanly find all the bits an pieces in case you ever want to start, send back or give to someone- charging case like it was designed by completely different UX team at Sony, no rechargeable, cheap pin/button to snap shut or open- not as small or comfy as they appear- yet another piece of software to install on my phone for full feature set- but worst of all they won't stay connected to. my phone, constant brown outs

Despite claims of being very comfortable and secure... they weren't. Yes, I tried every rubber tip. Maybe my ears just aren't shaped for these. They always felt like they would fall out after some head-shaking...

The sound is nice open back is uncommon but welcome on these type of device. I disabled media management in the app, but still these Bluetooth device are pausing arbitrarily my media playback. Would be great otherwise.

I loved the design. The open back sound in  bud is a great idea. I thought the sound quality was fine. But I really wanted to use them for calls, so that I can get natural feedback while talking. Problem is the battery life. I had two pairs and neither could keep going to over 2 hours. It's a shame. Everything else was good, but for the money, I wanted them to be executed better

reviewTitle: too big for my ears. eats hurt after wearing for some time
reviewDescription: Overall, cool idea, but headphones are too big even with the smallest ear tip and my ears hurt after some time. Can't use :'(

Edit at the end!TL;DR : After 13 months (warranty of 12 months), this 250$ pairs of earbuds is basically thrash.The right bud sounds like the driver is busted, and the left bud has always had trouble charging in the case (the clip inside the case doesn't hold on tigh to the earbud so it sometimes doesn't charge or register like the bud has been taken out of the case, so there are problems pairing as well).I find it so bad that a 250$ piece of tech doesn't have more than a year of warranty.The sound was good due to open back design, but comfort will depend from person to person since it depends on your ear shape. For me the right one is super confy but the left hurts if i wear it for more than a couple hours.I would not recommend this product and unless sony cha ges its warranty, I won't be buying from them anymore. 13 months of use for a busted driver is unforgivable, especially since i always use at low volume (use in public or before going to sleep).Edit : after 18 months or so of use, the right bud not only sounds like a busted driver, it wont hold charge properly. It will randomly loose charge and drain case battery overnight, even when plugged in. For all that is good and fair in this world, do not buy this product.

We purchased these in March.  I primarily wear them walking the dog, so the open-ear design was perfect for not blocking out traffic noise.The microphone quality is fantastic.  This is the first pair of earbuds I’ve owned that I’ve been able use for conversations with my elderly father.  Other earbuds pick up too much background noise, or create an echo that makes it hard for him to hear me.Unfortunately, after 9 months they are toast.  The speaker portion has separated, and while it fits back together now there is a buzzing in that ear.  When I contacted Sony for warranty, I was initially told by the agent that it’s “cosmetic” damage.  Then I was told that the warranty only covers the software, despite the warranty itself reading “This limited warranty covers only the hardware components packaged with the product.”  To add insult to injury, it was suggested that I drop them off for authorized repair at a store in Ontario (I am in Alberta).I admit that these have seen daily use.  I was ridiculously happy with them.  But I’m highly unlikely to spend another $300 on a pair of earbuds that don’t last a year, and won’t have the warranty honoured.  I’ve had significantly cheaper options that lasted for years with the same use.

Garbage tbh, they only connect to my android phone. They fail to pair on windows 11. If you manage to pair, it isn't actually paired and will silently disconnect from them if they appear to connect after pairing. No amount of setting changes works. I will likely return these as they do not work.Other gripes, the buttons are overly small, the lid is not spring loaded at all so good luck even getting the case open.

reviewTitle: These were perfect - until they deteriorate and distorte
